Choluteca, Honduras – March 2013

loans.use: to buy escargot, shrimp, salted nuts, sandwiches, sea bass, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Reydo

texts.es: Reydo, de 43 años de edad , esta casado con Ana, con quien tiene 3 hijos: Fermín, Mariluz y Jackelyn. Todos ellos viven en una casa rústica que Reydo construyó con ayuda de sus familiares la cual se ubica en un distrito agrícola.Reydo se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño. Manifiesta que ayudaba a sus padres en los cultivos de sus terrenos, desde entonces le agrado esa actividad. Por eso ahora, se encarga de cuidar sus sembríos de papas, maíz, arvejas y flores de gladiolos. Trabaja contento en el campo, al lado de su esposa. Además cuenta con animales de carga que le sirven mucho para esta actividad. “Éste mes estoy recogiendo las flores de gladiolos, y los precios son buenos, por las fiestas religiosas”, cuenta. En sus planes está empezar 2 siembras, una de arvejas y otra de maíz, ya que las lluvias empezaron y quiere aprovecharlas al máximo. Solicita de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Reydo, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Reydo, 43 years old, is married to Ana, with whom he has three children: Fermín, Mariluz, and Jackelyn. They live in a rustic house that Reydo built with the help of some family members. Their house is located in a farming district.

Reydo has made a living farming since he was a boy. He used to help his parents cultivate their land, an experience is is thankful to have had. Reydo takes care of his potato, corn, peas, and gladiola flowers. He is very happy growing these crops alongside his wife. They also take care of animals that help them work their land. 

"This month, I am gathering gladiola flowers. The market price is good because of the upcoming religious festivals," he says. Reydo plans to start two more crops, one of peas and one of corn, in order to take advantage of the coming rainy season. 

Reydo is requesting this loan in order to achieve his goals. He will invest the 2500 soles to buy organic fertilizer for his plants. Reydo pledges to make all his repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Elien

texts.en:
Elien is 51 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elien has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. Elien requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

Elien has been in this business for four years. In the future, Elien would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 42 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business of copra (coconut product) production to earn a living. She has been in business for over three years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and now has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for copra production.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for copra production

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is aged 51. He sells various merchandise and has been in the business for one year. He is married with seven children, three of them are still pursuing high school education while four have completed school. His wife is a farmer. He has requested a loan to add more items such as lotions, soaps, salt, and cooking oil for sale. He plans to use the profits to set up a shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Adiel

texts.en: Adiel is 29-years-old. He sells clothes and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, he wants to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is 50 years old and married with three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and now has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. His hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for him motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 52 years old, married and has two children, one in school.

Felomina is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Felomina requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to pay the laborer's salary for the cultivation of land.

Felomina has been farming sugarcane for 11 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felomina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to pay the laborer's salary for the cultavation of land

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 48 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production farm to earn a living. She has been in business for over five years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008 and now has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her business every day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en: Dionisia is a 42-year-old mother who aims to be successful in life. She was gifted with a child and they live happily in a rural community. To achieve her goals, she helps her husband in gaining income for the sake of their family. She engages in buying and selling vegetables while her husband cultivates their farm land. She wants to improve her business to increase her income, but is unable to because of inadequate capital. She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, garlic, cabbages, potatoes and sweet potatoes to sell. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, garlic, cabbages, potatoes and sweet potatoes to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Poblacion, North, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Cherie Ann

texts.en:
Cherie Ann is a 39-year-old single mom of one child. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been in this business for four months and earns about 35,000 PHP a month doing so.
Recently Cherie Ann joined GDMPC. She is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy the ingredients needed to make the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 29 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a snack food vending stand in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. Now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make sticky rice for snacks. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improves her living situations.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make sticky rice for snacks.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita works hard to support her family. Florita is widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.
Florita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional threads, needles and other tailoring materials needed for her business.
Florita has been in this business for 30 years now.
In the future, Florita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional threads, needles and other tailoring materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 50 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 16 years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 5,000 weekly. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, milk, biscuits, noodles, bread, canned goods and beverages. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, milk, biscuits, noodles, bread, canned goods and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 48-year-old diligent and hardworking women, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Three of her children are currently studying at school and two are working. Her husband has died, making Parveen a widow and left to manage all of the household expenses alone. One of her sons is laborer and he needs new tools for his construction work. Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy new tools like a hammer, nails, drill machine, etc. The old tools are obsolete and he needs these new tools to continue his work. She is very hopeful that the loan would be productive one for them and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her son.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 28-year-old hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and three children. Only one her son is currently going to school, as she is unable to afford educational expenses for all her children. Her husband is working in a textile company but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Naila is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her child’s educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past nine years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Naila has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future and her production can be increased. With new sewing machine she can get her work done in less time and more appropriately. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to expand her business and provide quality education to her children. With the profit amount she will pay her house rent. Naila and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in her business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 47 years old, and is a responsible mother of four children, living in Rawapindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband works in a fruit business and three of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household and educational expenses of their children, and they are facing many hurdles in life. Shehnaz has been helping her husband by operating a clothes business from her house for the last seven years. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. The main purpose of the loan is to buy new varieties of clothes at cheaper rates and then sell it on for a profit. In the, future she is looking forward to opening a small boutique in the market. She would save some money from the profits and pay the educational expenses of her children. She has a bright vision and this loan could help her to fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy new varieties of clothes.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Lourdes vive en una comunidad donde la gente habla la lengua mazahua, cuenta que tiene 36 años de edad por el momento está viviendo en unión libre con el señor Carlos juntos han formado una familia con sus cuatro hijos que van a la escuela anteriormente doña Lourdes ya habia estado en uno grupo grande esta vez ha solicitado un crédito individual para invertirlo en su negocio de venta y compra de pollos aunque tambien tiene otros negocios en los cuales necesita invertir como la tienda de abarrotes cuanta que desde que decidio solicitar credito a la institucion sin duda la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado porque ha tenido la gran oportunidad de invertir en su tienda de abarrotes, tambien tiene pensado invetir su cocina comprando algunas cosas que le hacen falta como verduras, condimentos para la preparacion de las comidas que realiza cuenta  "Yo todos los dias prepraro alimento para los profesores de las escuelas cercanas es una muy buena opcion porque asi me obtengo un dinerito extra para solventar los gastos de mi hogar" Doña Lourdes lleva ya cinco cinco ciclos trabajando con la institucion  platica que le ha ayudado mucho porque sus hijos pueden seguir estudiando le da mucho gusto esta situacion porque le gustaria que sus hijos sigan estudiando y terminar una carreratener una mejor calidad de vida que les permita  ya que ella no lo pudo realizar.
texts.en:
Doña Lourdes lives in a community where the people speak the Mazahua language. She is 36 years old and currently in a common-law relationship with Sr. Carlos. They have formed a family that includes four children who are in school. Lourdes was previously part of a larger group, but this time she is requesting an individual loan so that she can invest in her business of buying and selling chickens. She also has other businesses and needs to invest in her grocery store. Lourdes had no hesitation about requesting a loan from VisionFund Mexico.

Her family’s quality of life has improved because she has had the opportunity to invest in her grocery store. She also has plans to invest in her cooking by purchasing a few things that she is lacking, such as vegetables and condiments, for preparing food. Lourdes says, “Every day I prepare food for the school teachers nearby. This is a very good opportunity because I can earn some extra money for the household expenses.” Doña Lourdes has already participated in five loan cycles with VisionFund Mexico. She indicates that the loans have been a great help because her children are able to continue their studies. Lourdes is very pleased with her situation because she likes knowing that her children can continue their education, go on to finish a degree, and have a better quality of life since she was not able to accomplish these things herself.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and condiments for preparing food, as well as groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 34 years old, and is a hardworking and diligent women living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and four children. Her husband is a laborer and his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. Three of her children are going to school. 

Since 2005, Parveen has been operating an embroidery business, however due to financial constraints she is unable to expand her business. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can purchase new varieties of embroidery items including needles, colored threads, beads and buttons etc. This will not only help her to grow her business but will also increase her net income and savings. With the profit amount she is going to pay the educational expenses of her children and save some money for their marriages. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a fisherman from the town of Getafe, Bohol, and has been in the fishing business for 18 years now. 

Rolando is married and works hard in order to provide support to his family, especially for the schooling of his children. He is asking for a loan to buy to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and fuel for the boat. With a loan, Rolando will be able to improve his business like increasing his daily catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Rolando dreams of expanding his venture so that it will generate more income which he will use for the needs and expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and fuel for his boat.

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria is 60 years old, and is married with four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Eneria owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns 25,000PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 30,000PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, coffee and eggs. She hopes and dreams to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, coffee and eggs.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 36-year-old married man, living with his wife and three children, all of whom attend school. 

He has owned a car interior and upholestry repair shop since 2007. His job consists of repairing vehicle interiors and furniture. His wife works as a teacher and has done so for many years. 

Today, Elias is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase required quantities of leather and furniture accessories in order to respond to his client’s demands and make a fair income. In the future, he is planning to open a bigger store to buy and sell additional car spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase required quantities of leather and furniture accessories.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 55 years old, and is married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Thelma owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 3,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2007, and has now requested a loan of 5,500 to purchase spare parts and tyres. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situations.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tyres.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school aged children at their house, which is located in one of the most beautiful villages of Lebanon. Both Abbas and his wife are managing their own household. 

On a daily basis, Abbas works non-stop to provide his family with the needed income. He has been working in his own bakery for many years, and he is well known for his good place and delicious food.  He has loyal customers always asking for his delightful bread. 

Today, Abbas would like to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his childrenss school costs. He wishes to see them achieving higher educational levels. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. In the near future, he has more than few ideas to grow his domain, and he is thinking of taking more Kiva loans to better support his children, especially with the great result he has obtained from his first one.

loans.use: to pay his childrens' school costs.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS“, ella tiene 40 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras  pues lleva a vender a diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como cebollas, zanahorias, lechugas, perejil y otras más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Cirila is part of the Communal Bank “Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos”. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Cirila sells vegetables and travels to different markets in the city of Cusco.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, lettuce, parsley, and other types of produce. Cirila has been in this business for many years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete the payments.

loans.use: to buy onions, carrots, lettuce, parsley, and other types of produce.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 43 years old, and is married with three children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Lourdes has been farming sugarcane for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Ma. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marjul

texts.en: Marjul is 23 years old and a single mother of 1 child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a pedicab transport business in the local community to earn a living. She has been operating her business for over 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC this year, and now she has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better life and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 33 years old, married and has two children currently in school. 

Margie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margie has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Blanca Janeth

texts.es: Blanca se dedica a la agricultura de granos basicos (maiz y frijol) desde hace varios años vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa propia, con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de sus cultivos ha sacado adelante a su familia, ella solicita un credito para poder comprar mas insumos agricolas( semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros)y asi seguir obteniendo mas ganancias para solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca has been growing basic staples, such as corn and beans, for many years. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. With the profit she earns from the sale of her crops, her family is able to get ahead.

Blanca is requesting a loan so that she can buy more farming supplies such as seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, and other items. As a result, she can continue generating more profits so that she can pay for the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en: Alvin is 34 years old, married but has no children yet. Due to a lack of job opportunities, he put up a small eatery within their community to generate income. He and his wife help each other in managing the business. They have been operating the business for almost two years and usually earn a profit of only PHP 6,000.00 a month. They aimed to offer more dishes and expand their dining area to accommodate more customers but they don't have enough capital. For this reason, Alvin is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 25,000.00 to buy raw ingredients, seasonings and materials needed to expand his eatery. He is hoping that this loan will be a great help for him to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients, seasonings and materials needed to expand his eatery

location.town: Brgy. Poblacion, North, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 57 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a flower business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional flowers to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional flowers to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married with two children currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Nenita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.es: Aracelly tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada, y tiene dos  hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas doble prosito, para cría y leche. Ella quiere aumentar un poco la cantidad de animales, para tener más posibilidad de vender más crías. Ella se ha dedicado con la familia a la  ganadería. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Aracelly is 42 years old, married, and has two children. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cows for breeding and milk production. She wants to gradually increase the number of animals in her herd so that she will have more opportunities to sell. Aracelly and her family have been dedicated to raising livestock.

She has had no other previous loan with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle for breeding and milk production.

loans.name: Angelica Nayibe

texts.es:
Muy buenas tardes señores y señoras campo alto ella es Angélica  le da mucha alegría estar compartiendo sus anhelos y deseos  de estudiar en la institución  le parece una muy buena institución. 
Ya que no es muy fácil un recién graduado conseguir trabajo estable  para estos gastos la preocupación es esa, sabe  que las ganas de salir adelante son muy grandes pero a veces  la gente no le da las posibilidades de surgir así que apenas me entero de este convenio con kiva se llena de emoción para seguir estudiando y que su ayuda sería de gran satisfacción para ella  asi lograr terminar sus estudios junto a ustedes y le interesa entrar al programa de cocina porque le gusta mucho, muchas gracias por su atención.
texts.en:
Greetings Ladies and Gentlemen. Angélica is very happy to be sharing her wishes and dreams of studying at a fine institution. Since it is not easy to find a stable job soon after graduation, she is concerned about the expenses. Angélica has the drive to succeed, but sometimes people are not given the opportunity to move forward. Therefore, she is very excited about this opportunity from Kiva to continue her studies. Having this assistance to finish her education gives her great satisfaction.

With the help of interested Kiva lenders, Angélica will enter a culinary program because she enjoys this field. She expresses great thanks for this consideration.

loans.use: to finish a culinary program with CampoAlto.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Kevin Raul

texts.es: El Sr. Kevin tiene 19 años y es casado con un hijito de un año,  el se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya tres años el confecciona chamarras deportivas y todo sobre ropa deportiva, su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona de Alto Pampahasi,  Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Kevin va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de una maquina de costura y también de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión,  El Sr. Kevin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes, el  Sr. Kevin es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Kevin is 19 years old, married, and has a one-year-old son. For the past three years, he has been making sports jackets and other types of sportswear from a small workshop in his home in the District of Alto Pampahasi.

This loan is his first transaction with Emprender. Sr. Kevin will use the money to buy a sewing machine and also fabrics for making articles of clothing in bulk. His reason for requesting this loan is so that he can increase his investment capital. Sr. Kevin faces challenges in his business, such as trying to increase his profits, so he will utilize the benefits of this loan by purchasing materials for making products that are of good quality. As a result, he will generate more orders from his customers.

Sr. Kevin is a hardworking individual. He is pleased and appreciative of the support that Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in bulk and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es: Don jose de 30 años de edad se dedica al transporte de personal en su microbus, es un hombre responsable, trabajador y honesto con los ingresos que obtiene por los viajes que el realiza y con la ayuda de su esposa que es profesora logran cubrir algunos de los gastos que tienen en su hogar, vive con su hija de 4 años y su esposa, él solicita un credito para comprar unos repuestos que su vehiculo necesita ya que con los gastos de su hogar no ha podido comprarlos y su vehiculo es su fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Don Jose is 30 years old and provides transportation services with the use of his microbus. He is a responsible, hardworking, and honest individual. With the profits generated from his trips, he is able to cover some of the household expenses. He has the support of his wife, who works as a teacher. They live with their four-year-old daughter.

Don Jose is requesting a loan so that he can buy a few spare parts that are needed for his vehicle. He is not able to pay for these items since he has existing household expenses. His vehicle allows him to work and provides a source of income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a 30-year-old man from Homabay town in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Anyango and has two children who are five and two years old respectively.

He operates a money transfer business (M-PESA), a business he has been doing for the last three years. He makes a monthly income of KES.20,000. He is applying for his second loan, which he will use to increase the volume of his float so as to enable him to serve many clients. He will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

He has a dream of improving his business so that he can provide well for his family through better education and be a good member of society.

loans.use: to increase the volume of his money float.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like sardines, rice and other groceries needed for her business. Rebecca has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Rebecca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like sardines, rice and other groceries needed for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a buy-and-sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell. Virginia has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en: Maryjane is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 34 years old. Maryjane is married and has 4 children. She runs a general store for a living. Every month she earns 8,000 PHP and has been in this business for 8 years. She joined GDMPC in 2009. She asks for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline has a food stall business in Emali town. She sells fresh milk, yoghurt, soft drinks, cakes, vegetables and boiled eggs among other items. She is 30 years old and married with two children. She has been in this business for the past two years and it has been profitable.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a freezer, which she will use to keep and store the perishable food. These mostly include milk, soft drinks and vegetables.

She hopes to grow her business by opening another food stall and thereby make more income and be able to provide good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en:
Suleyman is 38 years old, married and a father of two school children. His family lives together with his pensioner parents. Suleyman's wife works as a cleaner at the local school. 

For the past 8 years, he has been raising cattle to improve the family living condition. He purchases cows and calves, fattens them for several months, then sells them for a profit at the cattle market. His father helps him a lot.

In order to expand his husbandry activity and earn a good income, Suleyman is seeking a loan to help him buy and sell a cow.

loans.use: to buy and sell a cow.

loans.name: Alba Lucía

texts.es:
Alba de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos. Toda su vida ha tenido que velar por el bienestar y la educación de ellos. Es una mujer emprendedora que no se deja oprimir por las circunstancias. Desde hace diez años conoce del oficio de la confección, gracias  a la oportunidad que le brindó un instituto de formación para el para el trabajo y el desarrollo humano. 
Después de laborar por más de ocho años como empleada, decidió emprender su proyecto de negocio, por lo cual inició desde su vivienda realizando arreglos de modistería y confección directa. 
Su mayor sueño es garantizarles a sus hijos educación y que tengan la oportunidad de convertirse en grandes profesionales. A nivel profesional sueña con consolidar su microempresa y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina recubridora con el fin mejorar la calidad en su producción.
texts.en:
39-year-old Alba is a single mother with three children.  She has had to take care of her children's well-being and education their whole lives.  Alba is an entrepreneurial woman who doesn't let herself become discouraged by life's events.  She has been in the sewing business for ten years now thanks to an opportunity she received from a training institute dedicated to work and human development.

After having worked for more than eight years as an employee, Alba decided to start her own business.  She set up the business in her home, offering alterations and dressmaking services.

Alba's biggest dream is to provide her children with an education so that they have the opportunity to become successful professionals.  On a business level, Alba dreams of strengthening her micro business and making the income she needs to support her household.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying an interlock sewing machine so that she can improve the quality of her work.

loans.use: to buy an interlock sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a display case and some hairdressing products

loans.name: Jessika Walesca

texts.es:
La Joven Jessika, de 25  años, vive con su hijo en su casa de habitación en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05 años a la venta de ropa nueva como ser pantalones, faldas, ropa interior de mujer, de niño, camisas sport, pantalones de mujer, vestidos, blusas, etc.
Jessika  su negocio está ubicado en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan
Jessika está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, blusas, camisas, calzonetas, blúmeres, calzoncillos, sandalias, accesorios de dama,  quiere compra al por mayor y así poder obtener más ganancias.
Jessika con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y  de igual forma mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Jessika su sueño es poder tener una tienda con todos los productos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013.
texts.en:
Young Jessika, 25 years old, lives with her son in her home located in a neighbourhood in San Lorenzo, in the South of Honduras. For 5 years she has worked selling new clothes, whether it is trousers, skirts, women's underwear, children's clothes, sports tops, women's trousers, dresses, blouses etc. Jessika's business is run from her home. Her clients are friends and neighbours who visit her daily.

Jessika is asking for this loan to buy more clothes such as trousers, dresses, skirts, blouses, shirts, shorts, men's and women's underwear, sandals, and women's accessories. She wants to buy in bulk and so increase her earnings. With the support of this loan, Jessika intends to supply the financial needs of her business and so increase her earnings in order to improve the quality of life for herself and her family a little. Jessika's dream is to be able to have a shop for all her products.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Ancent

texts.en:
Ancent is 35 years old and married with four children. He has a phone accessories sales shop in Emali town. He sells phones, chargers, batteries, phone covers and earphones. He also repairs mobile phones. He has been in this business for the past six years and it has been profitable.

This will be his 1st loan term with KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to buy more phone accessories to sell. These include covers, batteries and chargers. He also plans to buy new phones to sell. He anticipates making more income which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to expand his business and open another phone accessories sales business.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Corazones De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE ORO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, lechonería, venta de verduras, venta de leche, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace años de su madre, posteriormente decide trabajar con la venta de este producto ya que es rentable.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el mejoramiento de sus herramientas (compra vaca lechera) que adquirirá de las ferias las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en diversas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The 'Corazón de Oro' community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which has Juana as its president.  The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in are varied and include: selling cheese, selling suckling pig, selling vegetables, selling milk and running a neighborhood store.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit these small businesswomen.  Juana says that this is her first time with Pro Mujer, which she joined through an invitation from one of the institution's field officers who visited her at home.  Juana currently has a business making and selling cheese.  She says that she learned this business years ago from her mother and decided to work selling these products as it is profitable.

Juana will use this loan to buy a dairy cow.  She will buy the cow in one of the markets in a neighboring community.  After she has made her cheese, she will sell it in different markets in the city of La Paz.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her household.  Juana lives with her partner and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana replied that she likes the training sessions that focus on loan management and health.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 23 years old and in the laundry business. He is married to Ann. He has been in the business for the past two years and earns KES. 30,000 monthly. Victor is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy washing machines.
With the anticipated profits, he will expand his business. His future hopes and dreams are to have a larger laundry business.

loans.use: to buy washing machines.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 27 years old from Nakuru and is married with two children who are seven and three years old.
Ephantus has a transport business that he has been doing for the past four years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to repair his truck.
He hopes to own a fleet of vehicles in the near future and expand his business.

loans.use: to repair his transport truck.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda, de 47 años de edad , esta casada con Alfonso con quien tiene 3 hijos de 14, 9 y 5 años. Todos ellos viven en la casa de material rústico que construyeron con esfuerzo en un anexo agrícola.Clorinda es una madre tierna y una esposa responsable. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 22 años. Por eso confía en su desempeño como mujer de campo. Sus principales cultivos constan de arvejas, habas, cebada, maíz y flores de gladiolos. “En mi zona hay buenos terrenos, por eso crece de todo”, dice. Con el apoyo de su pareja, puede cubrir todo el trabajo que requiere el campo; pero muchas veces no es suficiente, por eso contratan más personal. Casi toda su producción la negocian en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. “Las arvejas, habas y maíz, se venden ahí y casi al instante, pero las flores de gladiolos son llevadas a otra feria”, menciona . Ahora espera volver a sembrar arvejas y habas, aprovechando las lluvias que empiezan a caer en este mes, por ello requiere de su apoyo financiero.Clorinda, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Clorinda, 47 years old, is married to Alfonso, with whom she has 3 children who are 14, 9 and 5 years old. They all live in a house of rustic materials which they built with some effort, on an agricultural enclosure. Clorinda is a loving mother and a responsible wife. She has worked in agriculture since the age of 22. This is why she is confident of her ability in agriculture work.

Her main crops consist of peas, beans, barley, corn and gladiolus flowers. "In my area there is good soil, so everything grows," she says. With the support of her partner, she can manage all the work the field needs, but often this is not enough. This is why she hires more staff. She sells almost all of her produce in the wholesale market in Tarma. "The peas, beans and corn sell there almost instantly, but the gladiolus flowers are taken to another fair," she adds. Now she hopes to go back to sowing peas and beans, taking advantage of the rains that start to fall this month, and for this she needs your financial support. Clorinda will invest the money in buying organic fertilizer to feed her crops, and she is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 38 años de edad esta casada Juan y juntos tienen 2 hijos: Cristian de 12 y Johnny de 6 años respectivamente. Todos ellos viven en la casa que construyeron hace 10 años.Nilda se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años, el tiempo que lleva conviviendo con su pareja. Desde entonces trabaja la tierra produciendo: arvejas, habas, cebada, flores de gladiolos y maíz. “Me conviene sembrar arvejas, habas y flores de gladiolos, porque en 4 meses ya estoy cosechando”, menciona.
Gracias a su constancia en sus labores ha logrado adquirir animales como toros, con los que ara la tierra además consiguió comprar un terreno .
Sus metas se centran en aumentar su producción por ello necesita abono orgánico, porque ya cuenta con las semillas que le proporcionan sus terrenos.  Nilda, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
38-year-old Nilda is married to Juan and the couple have two children: 12-year-old Cristian and 6-year-old Johnny.  They all live in a house that they built 10 years ago.  Nilda has been farming since she was 20, which is when she started living with her husband.  Over the years, she has worked the land growing peas, beans, barley, gladioli and corn.  "It works out well growing peas, beans and gladioli because they are ready to harvest in just four months", she says.

Thanks to her perseverance in her work, Nilda has managed to acquire animals such as bulls with which she plows her land.  She has also managed to buy a plot of land.  Her goals center around increasing her production.  In order to achieve this, she needs organic fertilizer.  Her land has already provided the seeds she needs.

Nilda will invest the 2,000 soles she has requested in buying organic fertilizer with which to feed her crops.  She promises to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Barry

texts.en: Barry is 20 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a retail business where he sells cosmetics such as lotions, soaps, etc. to earn a living. He has been in this business for over 2 years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC this year. Now he has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Tonkei

texts.en:
Tonkei is 40 years old, married to Lilian, and they are blessed with six children  between the ages of 18 and eight years old.
He has been farming for the last four years with a monthly income of KES. 12,000. He will be using the KES. 50,000 loan from KADET LTD to purchase seeds for planting and fertilizers.
Tonkei will be using the anticipated profits to educate his children and expand his business. His hope for the future is to see his family have a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 26 years old and lives with his parents in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking entrepreneur and a very honorable man who has had a grocery store for many years. He strives to provide for his family. He benefited from the first loan by being able to expand his business. He intends to expand his business further by opening a cosmetic materials store beside his grocery store to increase his profits. He has applied for a second youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy cosmetic materials and perfumes. He thanks Kiva for financing the first loan which helped him to enlarge his business. He hopes to be funded for a second loan by Kiva, he knows this will again help to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic materials and perfumes to help expand his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with two children aged 13 and nine years old.
Mary has a cereals business that she has been running for the past nine years and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more cereals like rice, green grams, etc. to add to her stock.
She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy various types of cereals for her store.

loans.name: Sunatullo

texts.ru: Сунатулло молодой и добрый человек. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Сунатулло является новичком в бизнесе. Он предоставляет услугу таксиста. Он старается преподнести качественную услугу и таким образом привлечь много клиентов, так как в его городе очень большая конкуренция. Он уже мечтает иметь детей, а для этого он должен создать хорошею условию дома. Он хочет развевать бизнес, но недавно у него сломалась машина и он не имеет денег для ремонта. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для ремонта автомашины. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sunatullo is a kind young man. He is married, but does not have children. He is new to the world of business. He provides taxi services for a living. He tries to give quality service to attract a large clientele because there is a lot of competition in his city. He is already dreaming of having children, but he needs to establish good living conditions in his home before starting a family. He wants to develop his business, but recently his car broke down and he does not have the financial means to get it repaired. Sunatullo is seeking a loan of 2,000 Tajikistan Somoni to get his car fixed. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn to sell, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of  GDMPC since 2011, and now she has applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure, for her farm.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a 29-year-old businessman. He runs a computer services business, offering typesetting, photocopying, booking binding and internet services. He has been in this business for the past three years and has an income of KES 25,000 monthly. Nelson is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He intends to use the loan to buy photocopying machines and refurbished computers. He will plough the anticipated profits back into the business. He hopes to have a stable business and that he will be able to open new branches.

loans.use: to buy photocopying machines and refurbished computers for his computer services business.

loans.name: Lucy Nyambura

texts.en: Lucy is happy about her previous loan, as it really helped her expand her business, selling milk from the dairy cow that she bought. Lucy has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes to diversify into the grocery business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en: Anabella is 39 years old, married with 1 child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been doing this business for over 4 years and earns 1,500 PHP every month. Annabella joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 2,000 PHP to purchase new tires. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is happy that her previous loan helped her a lot, as she was able to have a bountiful harvest during the past planting season. 

Milkah has applied for another loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy a cow that will help her get milk that she can sell. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan. 

She hopes that her business will expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian lives in Ruharo, a suburb in Mbarara municipality, with five children, all in school. She got married when she was 18 years to a man she loved. But later the husband deserted the family and, unknown to the wife, went abroad. Unfortunately the family had no income-generating business, and Lillian started to struggle for the survival of the children. That is when she got to know Ugafode Microfinance and acquired a loan of UGX 2,000,000, which helped her to start a small business dealing in children's wear. Because of her hard work, this business developed, and she managed to support her family and pay school fees for the children. She is applying for a loan to increase her working capital, and the balance will be used to clear school fees balance.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her children’s wear business and to pay tuition.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 54 years old and has four grown-up children. They live happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. To face the hardships of life, Nida engages in the hog-raising business to generate additional income. She aimed to raise more pigs to sell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through this loan, she believes that, someday, she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Cristina engages in the buying and selling of charcoal in their community to earn additional income. She is 39 years old and has six school-age children. She and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will become professionals someday. In this regard, they need to earn and save more income to satisfy their family’s daily necessities and support their children’s education. Cristina aims to acquire more stock of charcoal to sell but she has insufficient capital. She is asking for an additional of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. In the future, she believes that she will be able to improve her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Miringu Maina

texts.en:
Miringu is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully paying back the previous loans.
He is happy that his business did better after the previous loan as he was able to get a good harvest when the planting season was over. Mirungi wants to use the loan to buy some fertilizers and seedlings.
He hopes to see his business expand in the near future and be able to employ workers to help on his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 61 years old and widowed with 12 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell. She has been in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Izatullo

texts.ru: Изатулло 45 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. Его жена занимается купле продажей одежды. Изатулло более 3 года занимается услугой такси. Прежде он работал во многих местах, но его зарплата не хватала на жизнь и поэтому он менял место работы. Иззатулло данное время справляется с бизнесом отлично. Он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он должен отремонтировать машину, но не имеет средств. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для ремонта автомашины. Он в первые кредитуется в нашей организации и обещает погасить займ.  Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Izatullo is 45 years old, married, and has 4 grown children. His wife works in retail selling clothing. For over 3 years now, Izatullo has been providing taxi services for a living. Prior to that, he had worked in several different places, but the salaries that they offered were not sufficient to cover his living expenses, so he changed his employment. His current business is going very well, and he has his own regular clients. He needs to repair his vehicle, but he does not have the financial means to do so. He is seeking a loan of 5,000 Tajikistan Somoni to fix his car. This is first loan request from our organisation and he promises to repay it. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing food and pastries.

loans.name: Ángela Fanny

texts.es:
Ángela de 53 años de edad, es una mujer llena de ilusiones y muchos sueños por realizar. Siempre consideró que tener su propio negocio, era una de sus grandes metas por cumplir y gracias a su esfuerzo hoy este proyecto es su más bonita realidad. A mediados del año 2012, se aventuró a montar en su residencia un negocio dedicado a la  venta de minutos de celular, mecatos y confitería. 
Asegura que aunque se encuentra en la etapa de introducción, ha visto una respuesta positiva por parte de los vecinos y las personas del sector, situación que la motiva a seguir en pro de su labor.
Su mayor prioridad es la educación de su hijo de 18 años de edad, el cual se encuentra próximo a iniciar sus estudios universitarios.
Con el fin de aumentar la variedad de productos, y garantizar la educación de su hijo, Ángela se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido, el cual le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y comenzar a materializar sus deseos y los de su hijo.
texts.en:
Ángela, 53, is a woman who is full of hopes and dreams to accomplish. She always believed that having her own business was one of her greatest goals to achieve, and thanks to her efforts, this project is now her most beautiful reality. In mid-2012 she set out to open a business in her home, dedicated to the sale of mobile phone credit, snacks, and candy.

She says that although she is in the introductory phase, she has seen a positive response from her neighbors and people in her community, which motivates her to keep going with her work. Her greatest priority is the education of her 18-year-old son, who will start his university studies soon. 

In order to increase the variety of products she offers and to guarantee an education for her son, Ángela has applied for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise. This will allow her to generate a higher income and to begin making her wishes come true, as well as those of her son.

loans.use: to buy snacks and candy.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca 46 años de edad, es una mujer a la que le ha tocado rebuscarse la vida para brindarles a sus tres hijos una vivienda y alimentación. Por su difícil condición económica ha realizado todo tipo de labores con el fin de generar los recursos necesarios para la supervivencia familiar.
Su abuelo era propietario de una tienda, por lo cual Blanca aprendió de la labor y al fallecer este, ella se quedó con el negocio en el que labora actualmente. Gracias a su actividad ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida y les ha brindado educación a sus hijos. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el cual comprará productos de la canasta familiar, con el objeto de aumentar sus ventas. Su mayor sueño es mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
46-year-old Blanca is a woman who has had to work hard in life to find ways to provide her three children with food and a roof over their heads.  Owing to her poor financial situation, Blanca has worked in a number of different jobs in order to make the money she needs to provide for her family.

Blanca's grandfather owned a store where Blanca learned the ropes and, when he died, she inherited the business in which she still works today.  Thanks to her business, Blanca has managed to improve her quality of life and has been able to ensure her children receive an education.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy basic household products with the aim of increasing her sales.  Her biggest dream is to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Zula

texts.en: Zula is a single mother hailing from Katete in Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school after getting pregnant at a very early age. After that incident, she lost support from her parents and unfortunately she didn’t know the father of her child. She later got a donation from her aunt and started a retail business in a nearby market to provide for her survival as well as the well-being of her child. She sells general items like tomatoes, onions, salt, and soap among others things because such a business is sustainable and there is also demand for the items from many people. She is requesting a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to increase her working capital by buying additional items to sell. She is a resilient and determined person. She also thanks Kiva lenders for choosing to partner with her.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise needed to stock the shelves of her general store.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully paying off his previous loan, which helped increase his shop's stock. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.  He wants to use the money to buy peas and venture into a cereals business as a secondary business. He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy peas to sell.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en: This marks Bendera's third borrowing to help her pay school fees for the children. She will buy more stock of fish to sell. She has been servicing her loan well and she hopes to continue borrowing for the expansion of her business and greater profit.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in order to pay school fees for the children.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida, 32 years old, is married to a truck driver and they are blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 5 years. In this business she's earning an income of about Php 3,500 a month. She would like to request a loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, milk, biscuits, noodles, canned goods and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted and her business will improve more so that she will gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, milk, biscuits, noodles, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
La  señora Ruth de 56 años, vive con sus 02 hijo  en su casa de habitación en un barrio de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20 años a la elaboración y venta de vestidos, pantalones de mujer, pantalones de hombre, trajes de señora, etc. 
Doña Ruth su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que el visitan de diferentes barrios, de donde vive, le prefieren por su buena atención y por su buen trabajo para dejar lo que le piden muy bien 
Doña Ruth Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de telas, hilos, agujas de máquina y adornos para sus diferentes diseños que hace en la sastrería.
Doña Ruth está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma ya que con la ayuda de los préstamos que se le han brindado a podido aumentar sus materiales y  hacer diferentes tipos de trajes.
Doña Ruth su sueño ampliar su negocio y salir adelante con  la educación de sus hijos 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo  del 2013.
texts.en:
Señora Ruth is 56 years old. She lives with her 2 children in her home in a neighbourhood of San Lorenzo, in the South of Honduras. For 20 years she has worked making and selling clothes, women's trousers, men's trousers, women's suits etc. Doña Ruth's business is located at her home. Her clients are her friends and neighbours who visit her from different neighbourhoods to where she lives. They prefer to come to her for her courtesy and her good work, and so she has a lot of orders.

Doña Ruth is asking for this loan to buy fabrics, threads, sewing machine needles and trimmings for the different designs she makes for her tailoring business. She is very happy to work with Prisma since with the help of the loans she has been offered, she has been able to increase her stock of materials and make different kinds of outfits. Doña Ruth's dream is to expand her business and advance the education of her children.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, sewing machine needles and trimmings for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Bertha Edilia

texts.es:
Bertha de 54 años de edad, es una mujer que se ha caracterizado por su emprendimiento y ganas de sacar a su familia adelante, después de sufrir el abandono de su esposo, se vio en la necesidad de laborar para sostener a sus dos hijos. Por su carencia educativa el acceso al mundo laboral fue muy limitado, lo que la condujo a subemplearse y hoy se dedica a la venta de gorras y accesorios en el centro de la ciudad de Medellín, Colombia. Gracias a su actividad ha logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de surtido con el fin de ampliar el portafolio de productos y aumentar el nivel de ventas. 
Su mayor sueño es poder brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad con el fin de que se conviertan en profesionales y puedan tener mejores oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Bertha, 54, is a woman who is characterized by her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to provide for her family. After suffering from the abandonment of her husband, she saw the need to work in order to sustain her two children. 

Due to her lack of education, her access to the working world was very limited, which led her to work for herself. Now she makes a living selling baseball caps and accessories in the center of the city of Medellín, Colombia. Thanks to this business activity, she has managed to improve her family's quality of life.

She has applied for a loan which she will use to buy merchandise, with the goal of expanding the range of products she offers and increasing her sales.

Her biggest dream is to be able to offer her children the opportunity to go to college, in order to become professionals who will have greater job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy shirts, socks, and tights.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 65-year-old retired woman. She lives in Persati village in the Baghdati district with her retired husband, her 41-year-old son, her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren who are going to school. Liana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have a vineyard. From the harvested grapes Liana’s husband makes wine to sell locally at the markets. They also have 2 pigs and 50 rabbits. From the pigs they sell piglets, and rabbits are sold to the restaurants as a meat. The total family income is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses.

Liana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Liana will purchase 40 beehives with bee colonies. She wants to expand this business, and after selling the honey, part of the profit will be reinvested. Liana will increase the number of bee colonies and produce more honey. Increased income will help her to significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase 40 beehives with bee colonies.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and only child. He has owned a motorcycle repair shop since 2009 where he performs maintenance on different types of motorcycles, both internally and externally. His business income is vital for the family, as he is their only support. 

Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase the needed spare parts to better serve his customers. He confirms that this loan will help him achieve remarkable growth in a short period of time. He is sure that this loan will also be an assistance for him monetarily and allow him to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase the needed spare parts to better serve his customers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been farming and the business is doing well. He used his previous loan well and he managed to open a general shop to manage besides farming.

John is applying for his third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more stock of soft drinks, sugar, milk, etc., for sale in the general shop. His farm did well after he took out the previous loan and he made a good harvest from it. He hopes that his businesses will expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La Sra. Estela tiene 40 año, casada con tres hijos de las edades de 16, 14 y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en una populosa feria de ciudad de el alto este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Estela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, La Sra. Estela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes.
texts.en:
Estela, 40, is married with three children, ages 8, 14, and 16. She makes a living selling used clothing from her stall, which is located in a popular market in the city of El Alto.

This loan is her second with the institution. Estela will use this loan to buy bundles of used clothing for her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is her lack of capital. 

Estela confronts challenges in her business, such as competition from the many other people who work in this area. She will use her earnings to continue improving her sales stall. Her wish for her business is to have a stock of merchandise to offer a variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 20-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and two siblings. She works as a private teacher and has almost two years of experience. She likes her occupation and wishes to help learners get their needed education. She has arranged a special room in her house where she receives her students. 

To be able to supplement her income, she’s asking today for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase added books and thus enrich her education. She notes that these changes will increase her probability of receiving added students, which would increase her income and improve her way of living. She might get married in the near future and have a family and children. This is one of her greatest dreams.

loans.use: to purchase added books and enrich her education.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old single young man. For the past two years, Mahmoud has had a butcher shop which is located in a densely populated residential area, and he has many loyal customers. It is a profitable project and his only source of income.

He is requesting a 1,500 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing sheep and cow meat for the butcher shop he owns. This will enhance his work and increase his customers' requests to purchase meat. This will increase his income and offer him better living conditions. Mahmoud is photographed in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase meat for the butcher shop to sell.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 41 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a laundry for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $3 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Chanthy requests a loan of $500 to purchase zinc to build her house’s roof. This purchase will help her complete building her house. In the future, she would like to have a washing machine to use for the laundry and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase zinc to build her house roof

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hyline is a 32-year-old tailor. She is a married mother of two. She has been sewing clothes for her customers for the last five years. She earns a monthly income of 9,500 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Hyline is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced recently by a KADET staff member. She intends to use the loan to purchase more materials and sewing threads. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and add more stock. Her hopes and dreams are to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and sewing threads

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en:
Nawale is a friendly and kind young woman. She’s from Lebanon and is 44 years old. She is married to Ali and has three children. Nawale and her husband are working really hard to provide the family with their needed income.  When she found that their income did not satisfy their needs, she decided to launch her clothing business from her home with the small amount of money she already had. 

She sells a wide variety of clothes from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. Her husband also works on his own, as he is their main income provider. To better develop her work, she’s requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas. s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, t-shirts and many other items. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 50-year-old mother who was gifted with four children. Having no other source of income, she engages in the direct selling of Avon, plastic ware, Tupperware, Natasha and MSE products in their community to generate income. She aims to continue and improve the business in order to earn a higher income to satisfy their basic needs and save for future emergencies. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy more stock of Avon, plastic ware, Tupperware, Natasha and MSE products to sell. She hopes that someday she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon, plastic ware, Tupperware, Natasha and MSE products to sell.

loans.name: Rort Mony

texts.en:
Rort Mony is 43 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $5 daily.

Rort Mony is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home in order to generate additional income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 32 years old and married with two children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a vulcanizing shop in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over three years and earns 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. 

Julie joined GDMPC in 2010. He has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional materials for his vulcanizing shop. His hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for his vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, 45 years old, is married to a farmer and they blessed with four children. She's been selling vegetables in their village for almost 13 years. In this business she's earning a net income of Php 5,000 a month. She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase vegetables to sell such as string beans, eggplants, squash, and cabbage. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted and her business will become profitable so that she can gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell such as string beans, eggplants, squash, and cabbage.

loans.name: Phearom

texts.en:
Phearom is 27 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling grocery and coffee for more than two years, earning approximately $4 each day. Her husband is a commune clerk who makes an income of $2 daily.
