To improve her family’s livelihood, Phearom is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries for resale. By doing so, she will be able to make more profit. In the future, she would like to expand her shop and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo sigue con la misma actividad de confección de pantalones, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de tela para la confección de pantalones  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de tela al por mayor y cierres para confeccionar prendas ya que tiene pedidos de  instituciones así que quiere abastecerse de este producto y así generar más ingresos esta época.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is still doing the same work making pants. He says it went well with his former loan, since he used it to buy fabric for making pants. 

On this occasion, he is requesting the loan to purchase fabric and clasps wholesale in order to make clothes, since he already has orders from institutions and he wants to stock up on this product and thereby generate more income this time.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es: Nelson, es un joven de 32 años de edad que busca como salir adelante una vez terminando sus estudios universitario, en la actualidad cursa la carrera de Ing. en sistemas, gracias al apoyo de sus padres continua con sus estudios ya que el no ha podido encontrar trabajo, pero su mayor ilusión es terminar su profesión, por tal motivo solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación y así lograr obtener un buen empleo para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is a young man of 32 who is looking for a way to get ahead once he is finished with his university studies. Currently he is studying a Systems Engineering degree. Thanks to the support of his parents he has continued with his studies, since he has not been able to find work. 

But his greatest dream is to finish his degree, which is why he is requesting the loan in order to pay for his final course and that way be able to obtain a good job in order to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for his final class

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Buenas tardes. Felicitas es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Virgen De Guadalupe” un grupo responsable y trabajadores, dedicados a distintas actividades comerciales, la cual está  integrada por 09 personas. Felicita comenzó en la venta de golosinas, con el transcurso del tiempo y el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos puedo  emprender su negocio de la venta de comida al paso como anticuchos, pollo, alita, etc. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo a podido mejorar su vivienda. Su mayor deseo es de poner una tienda donde brinde productos de primera necesidad y de esta manera mejore sus ingresos. El crédito que solicito lo destinó para la compra de insumos como pollo, papa, ensaladas y cubiertos. El grupo agradece el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Felicita se encuentra de pie es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste una blusa floreada y pantalón color beige.
texts.en: Good afternoon. Felicita is a member of the “Virgen De Guadalupe” community bank. It is a responsible and hardworking group, dedicated to different business activities. It is made up of 9 people. Felicita started out selling candies and over time and by using her savings well, she was able to start her business selling street food such as kebabs, chicken, chicken wings, etc.  She is happy because thanks to her hard work she has been able to improve her home. Her biggest wish is to open a store where she can offer basic necessity products and thus improve her income. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy ingredients such as chicken, potatoes, vegetables, as well as cutlery. The group is grateful for the loan that has been offered and committed to continuing to work well. Felicita is standing first from the left and is wearing a flowered blouse and beige pants.

loans.use: to buy chicken, potatoes, vegetables and cutlery.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe está conformada por 8 integrantes, madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ellas se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, que lucha día a día para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus  a sus pequeños hijos.
 
La coordinadora del banco comunal Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe es  Rosa Argentina, la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de pago de las integrantes del banco que sean realizadas en tiempo y forma. Rosa tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería, la cual es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de shampoo, café, sal, frijoles, pan, leche, jugos, frescos naturales, hielo en bolsa. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe is made up of 8 members. They are single mother with 20 children under their responsibility. They are from Sauce, in the western part of the country. They are described as hardworking, responsible, and eager to get ahead. They fight every day to offer their young children the best quality of life.
 
The bank coordinator for Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe is Rosa Argentina. She is responsible for the members' payments which they do correctly and on time. Rosa's activity is "pulperia", which is a small store that sells things such as shampoo, coffee, salt, beans, bread, milk, juices, natural juices, and bagged ice. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the near future she can make better income. The Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe communal bank is grateful for the Kiva investors' help that they offer to low income people in places like Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store buying edible products and others such as shampoo, coffee, salt, beans, bread, milk, juices, natural juices and bagged ice.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Dios es Amor está conformado por 9 integrantes madres solteras, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ellas se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, que han cumplido con sus cuotas de pagos anteriores en tiempo y forma, y con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo estudiar por la pobreza en la que viven, y luchan día a día para Salir adelante con sus pequeños hijos.

Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor, tiene sus diferentes actividades económicas.  Bertha es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica la venta queso  de leche, y cuajada en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 8 horas diaria, ofreciendo sus productos, a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de leche, y cuajada  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Dios es Amor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Dios es Amor communal bank is made up of 9 members who are single mothers. They have 20 children under their responsibility. They are from Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern part of the country. They are described as being hardworking and responsible. They have made all of their previous payments on time and correctly.  They are eager to get ahead. Unfortunately, none of them was able to go to school because of the poverty they live in. They fight every day to get ahead with their young children.

Thanks to their enterprising spirit, they have different economic activities. Bertha is the communal bank's coordinator and her economic activity is selling cheese, milk and curds from her home and as a street vendor. She works at her activity 8 hours a day, offering her products to regular and new customers.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital to buy milk and curds so that in the near future she can improve her income. The Dios es Amor communal bank is grateful for the help from the Kiva investors that they offered to poor people in places like Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business selling dairy products such as cheese, milk, and curds.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anabelle has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Anabelle requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es:
Pedro Francisco de 44 años de edad, casado, con un hijo que estudia en la Universidad, originario de Loen, lugar  que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Pedro es una persona de escasos recursos económicos con un salario de básico como cartero de una de las instituciones de la localidad. Lamentablemente  por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria pero le hubiera gustado ser Matemático
El objetivo del crédito es para la construcción de una casita, ya que con mucha dificulta ha podido comprar un terreno, y desea construir, para tener un lugar propio  para vivir. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como arena, cemento, perlines, bloques, clavos, hierro. Y de dicha forma poder cumplir con uno de sus sueños más deseados de tener un lugar propio para vivir. Pedro Francisco agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua .
texts.en:
Pedro Francisco, 44, is married with one son who is studying in a university. He is originally from Leon, a place located in the western region of the country. Pedro is a person who is economically disadvantaged and who has a basic salary as a mailman for one of the local institutions.

Regrettably, due to a lack of economic resources, he was unable to study a university degree but he would have liked to have been a mathematician.

The objective of the loan is to build a little house, since with much difficulty he has been able to buy some land, and he hopes to start building in order to have his own place to live. With the funding, he will buy construction material such as sand, cement, roof beams, blocks, nails, and iron. 

In this way he will be able to achieve one of his most sought-after dreams of having his own place to live. Pedro Francisco appreciates the help that the Kiva investors offer to people with limited resources and and from poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, roof beams, blocks, nails, and iron

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Don Wilfredo, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en una colonia del municipio de San Francisco, que pertenece a San Juan Pueblo.  Don Wilfredo tiene un terreno que colinda con un rio y ha hecho un balneario. Hace dos años el presta el servicio del balneario y construye  champas para turistas que le solicitan y que visitan el lugar. El aprovecha a vender golosinas como churros, refrescos, agua, dulces y otros. El ha  solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar golosinas como refrescos, agua, churros y otros para vender y generar otros ingresos. Su meta es obtener ingresos para que sus hijos tengan un bienestar económico.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 46 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of San Francisco, which belongs to San Juan Pueblo.  Wilfredo has a lot of land where there is a river. He has set up a swimming area there. He has had this swimming area business for two years. He builds tents for tourists who ask for them when they visit. He sells snacks such as churros, beverages, water, candies and more. He has asked for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras to buy snacks such as beverages, water, churros and more to sell and generate more income. His goal is to obtain income so his children can have financial wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy snack food (beverages, churros, water, candy etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is still in the business of selling gas cylinders. After getting the financial help from KADET LTD and Kiva, her monthly income has increased and now she earns more than 18,000 KES. She is very grateful for the previous loan.

Lilian is now applying for her second business loan to purchase more gas cylinders for sale since her customer base has expanded. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest back into the business. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more gas cylinders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more materials and sewing threads

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 54 years old. She lives in the small village of Khashuri District with her husband. Marine has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, they have 2 hectares of agricultural land, which have not been cultivated during the last 5 years. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Marine requested a loan from Credo to start-up the family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Marine will cultivate the land and sow potatoes and haricot. She will be able to sell the harvested products and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to cultivate the land and sow potatoes and haricot

loans.name: Sreypich

texts.en:
Sreypich (in the photo), age 22, is single and she is a third year student. Her major is Khmer Literature. 

Sreypich lives with her parents in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. Her parents make and sell typical Cambodian cakes. When she is not at school, Sreypich also assists her parents in the business. 

Sreypich decided to ask for a higher education loan in the amount of 250 USD to pay for pay for school fees.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Channarith

texts.en:
Channarith is 30 years old. He is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman who makes an income of 12 USD daily. His wife is a housekeeper. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Channarith is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help him reduce the transportation expenses. 

In the future, he would like to take another loan from KREDIT to expand his business and send his children to a good school. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room on the top floor of the home.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun is 48 years old. He is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction worker for more than seven years, earning approximately $4 each day. His wife is a housekeeper. Three of the children are employed. They are construction workers and a garment worker. They earn about $9 per day.

Sun requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a plot of land to use for building a new house. This money will help him obtain an appropriate place to live. In the future, he would like to run an additional business and help send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to use for building a new house

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La Sra. Valentina tiene 43 años,  tiene un hijo de la edad de 15, años, ella se dedica al crianza de ganado y al comercio de carne ella comercializa sus productos en la comunidad de Chirapaca,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Valentina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ganado para el faenado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere  tener carne para la venta, la Sra. Valentina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias carnicerías por la localidad,  pero ella tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de una congeladora grande, su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Valentina is 43 years old and has a 15 year old son. She works raising livestock and selling meat. She sells her products in the community of Chirapaca.

This loan is her first with the institution, and Valentina will use it to buy livestock for slaughter. Her reason for asking for this loan is that she wants to have meat to sell.

Valentina faces challenges in her business, including competition, since there are already several butchers in her area. However, she has a large clientele because of the friendliness with which she treats her customers. She will use her profits to buy a large freezer. Her desire for her business is to have a stable and profitable business, and to increase her earnings in this way.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a 26 year-old mother of one. She got her first Kiva loan a year ago and has grown her business by 100 percent. She finished paying off her loan in August of 2012 and has since opened two more mobile money transfer shops in her hometown of Kitwe. She now has seven employees in total.  Today, Sandra is taking out a second loan so that she can be able to finance her third shop. She will use this loan as working capital to serve customers who come to send and receive money from her new shop.

Sandra believes her business has been successful because she treats her employees right by giving them targets every month and giving them incentives on top of their monthly salaries. She says running a business is not easy but if you treat people right, then they will take enough ownership and do their jobs right.

When asked what she would like to say to the Kiva lenders, Sandra says the assistance from her lenders has changed her business. By increasing her working capital, Sandra says she was able to serve more customers and earn a lot of profits. The profits helped her to have a successful wedding and buy necessities for her newborn son. She is very grateful.

loans.use: To serve customers who want to send and receive money from her new mobile money shop

loans.name: Laiheang

texts.en:
Laiheang (pictured here), age 19, is single. She lives with her sister and widowed mother in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Laiheang is applying for her first Kiva loan in the amount of $400 to pay for her school fees. She has finished her first semester of the first year of her accounting institute in Phnom Penh and she will continue her second semester of the first year soon. 

She will use money from the loan to pay for second semester of first year and first semester of second year.

loans.use: To pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Sauy

texts.en: Sauy is 34 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Due to lack of funds, Sauy is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is married. She and her husband Reynaldo work hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Christy requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Christy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad is a 35 years old married man living with his four children in Taiz, Yemen. He has made a lot of effort to provide his family. He dreams of a better future and brighter world to surround him, but life in Yemen where he lives is full of challenges and difficulties. He came to think that the only way to secure his future was to establish his own micro-enterprise. He had a small grocery store which is not running well, then he shifted to start a grocery business another area. He would like to enlarge his business to increase his profit. So, he is taking a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grocery items and other goods required by his customers.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other goods required by his customers.

loans.name: Samit

texts.en: Samit is 64 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $13 daily. Due to lack of funds, Samit requests a loan of $1500 to purchase construction materials to complete building her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery and vegetable store at home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to complete building her house.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 46 years old and supports a family of ten members. Paul is married to Jane and their children are aged between 6 and 18 years old.

Paul is a horticultural farmer and has been in the business for the last five years making a monthly income of Kes 30,000. He learned about Kadet from a markerting campain that was done by Kadet officers in his area. He has acquired a second loan of Kes 25,000 which will facilitate preparation of his land for planting as well as purchasing of seedlings.

He plans to use the proceeds to educate his children as well as expand the family business. His dream is to see his family improve its living standards.

loans.use: to prepare the land and buy planting seedlings

loans.name: Myrlinda

texts.en: Myrlinda is 43 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee and dried fish. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee and dried fish

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 61 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to buy a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, 36 years old, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost four years. With this business, she's earning a net income amounting to Php 6,000 a month. She would like to take a loan amounting to Php 15,000 to purchase condiments, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase condiments, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Irene Njoki

texts.en:
Irene is happy that the previous loan helped her a lot in the farming business as she was able to harvest a lot from her farm. 


She is now applying for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy a dairy cow to use in her farm.

Irene hopes to see her dairy business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 47 years old. He lives in Orkhevi village near Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with his wife Tamar and two daughters who are going to school. Hamlet requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Hamlet is working at the local market, selling fruits and vegetables. His wife is working at the supermarket and they both get small monthly salaries. 
Hamlet requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Hamlet will purchase a car and a stock of fruits and vegetables to start trading himself. Hamlet will go to the local market in the capital city, buy products at the wholesale price and sell it to the resellers with the price mark-up in his district.  He is already very experienced in this field so he hopes the new business will be profitable. Part of the profit Hamlet will be reinvesting in the same business so he can develop and earn more income for the family. With the increased income Hamlet will be able to provide better living conditions for his family and also provide for his daughters' future education.

loans.use: To purchase a car and a stock of fruits and vegetables to start trading.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture inside his pharmacy.
Manal is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and two daughters. Manal is a housewife and her husband is a pharmacist. For the past four years, Manal's husband has had a pharmacy, which is a profitable project and has many loyal customers, but also needs more support from time to time to cover some costs.
Manal is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing missing medicine to resell. Manal's husband is looking in the future to expand his pharmacy and bring in more types of medicine and medical preparations.

loans.use: Buy medicine required for the pharmacy

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gloria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 21,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell to customers.

Gloria has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to buy a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 54-year-old retail shop proprietor in Voi, Kenya. He is a married father of five whose spouse brings in additional income. He has been in this business for the last ten years and has done great.

This marks his first borrowing with KADET LTD to finance his business. He will purchase stock of milk, loaves of bread, sugar, cooking fat and tea leaves for his shop. The anticipated profit will be used to pay back his loan.

Andrew hopes to grow his business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock of milk, loaves of bread, sugar, cooking fat and tea leaves

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 23-year-old single woman, who has been working as a hairdresser since she was fourteen years old. Nancy is a Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp. Her dream is to develop her business, and open a beauty salon in the future which will improve her and her family's social and financial situations.
In addition to being a hairdresser, Nancy also sells beauty cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for her customers, to increase her income. To reply widely to her customers' needs with a wide range of newly-released beauty cosmetics and perfumes, Nancy is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, and is very excited to take this step forward.

loans.use: To increase her business capital with newly-released cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Jeff Anderson

texts.es:
Su nombre es Jeff, no les contara la historia de su vida pero brevemente les contara porque su meta es ser el mejor diseñador grafico y mejor publicista.
Desde pequeño su hobby ha sido dibujar y crear cosas que vengan de su imaginación, ser muy atento a las cosas, muy servicial y colaborador. Entro a las Mercedes a estudiar Arte Grafico Y Publicitario porque quiere en un futuro ser un diseñador grafico reconocido por hacer bien sus trabajos y tener felices a los clientes con lo que realiza.
Es responsable y le a agrada hacer sus trabajos ya que le encanta diseñar y crear cosas innovadoras y que llamen la atención de las personas de manera positiva y darles a entender que la creatividad y la imaginación no tienen límites y que se pude llegar a ser grande si solo se imagina y se hace un mundo diferente lleno de cosas gratificantes y tolerantes para los demás. 
La mejor forma de crear es ser libre e imaginar, se siento identificado con esta frase ya se me siento libre y feliz para poder crear e imaginar, con ayuda de los que lo rodean logara tener un buen desempeño en la parte estudiantil y en la parte social 
Si Kiva le ayudara con este convenio será gratificante ya que podra costearse los transportes, trabajos  y alimentación mientras esté estudiando ya que por el momento se encuentro desempleado ya que el servicio militar se lo han aplazado hasta que termine la carrera y al no poder tener una certificación de esto en ningún lugar lo reciben si no tiene la libreta militar o la constancia de aplazado y se le dificulta poder pagar el costo total del estudio, por tal motivo agradece a kiva si le apoya con este convenio para llegar a ser un buen diseñador gráfico y buen publicista y no quedarse atrás por no tener la oportunidad  de estudiar por no poder tener los recursos necesarios para pagar esta carrera.
texts.en:
His name is Jeff. His goal is to be the best grafic designer and a better publicist.

Since he was little, his hobby has been drawing and creating things from his imagination. He is very attentive to things, very helpful and a colaborator. He came to Mercedes to study graphic art and advertising because he wants to be a graphic designer in the future. He wants to be recognized for his good work and to have happy customers.

He is responsible and enjoys his jobs since he loves to design and create innovative things that call attention to people in a positive way and gives them the understanding that creativity and imagination have no limits, and that they can be great if they only imagine and it will become a different world that is rewarding and tolerant of others.

The best way to create is to be free and to imagine. He identifies with this phrase because he feels free and happy to be able to create and imagine, with the help of those around him, to perform well as a student and socially.

If Kiva helps with this agreement, it will be rewarding because he will be able to afford transportation, work, and food while he is studying since he is currently unemployed since his military service has been deferred until he finishes school. It is very difficult to pay for the total cost of his program. For this reason, he thanks Kiva for its support and he will thank you by becoming a good graphic designer and a good publicist and not being held back because he didn't have the opportunity to study because of not having the resources necessary to pay for his career.

loans.use: to complete his graphic design program.

loans.name: Mujeres De Confianza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Confianza está conformado por 8 integrantes, madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, lo cual luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 

La coordinadora del banco común mujeres de Confianza es Reyna Isabel la cual tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos para destace. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de un lote de cerdos en pie , para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ella dedica  a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias. El banco comunal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Mujeres de Confianza' consists of 8 members, who are single mothers with 20 children under their care. They are from El Sauce, which is located in the western part of the country. These women are hard-working, responsible and eager for personal growth, and they fight day by day to provide a better future for their children.

The coordinator of the communal bank 'Mujeres de Confianza' is Reyna Isabel, who raises and sells hogs for butchering for a living. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business with a lot of hogs for buying and selling. In this way she will have better earnings in the near future.

She dedicates 12 hours a day to running her business. The communal bank is thankful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with hogs for buying and selling.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita and her husband are both farmers residing in a rural community. They were blessed with three children and they want them to become successful someday. For this reason, Jovita engages in cooking and selling meals and snacks to generate additional income. She aims to strengthen this business in order to earn more profits.

Jovita is asking for additional capital of 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy pork, dressed chicken, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the local community. She is hoping that the loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pork, dressed chicken, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold

loans.name: Harutiun

texts.en:
Harutiun is 45 years old. He lives in Akhalkalaki District with his wife, two children and his mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. 

Harutiun requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly pension of Harutiun’s mother and a small income earned by his wife, working as saleslady at a local chemist's. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence-poor category. 

Harutiun requested a loan from Credo to re-start the family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. this start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received loan, Harutiun will re-open a chemist's at the local hospital, which was closed after the hospital administration changed. Nowadays, he has an agreement with the new administration to open the chemist's again. He will purchase medicines and inventory for starting the business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to re-start the chemist's at the local hospital

loans.name: Jessebel

texts.en:
Jessebel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fish and other seafood to sell.

Jessebel successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

NWTF is re-listing Jessebel's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and other seafood to sell.

loans.name: Matayo

texts.en:
Matayo lives in Malava, a small town in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Matayo is married, and has one child. His wife is also a farmer, and together they grow maize, beans and cassava, and also keep poultry on their land. Matayo likes beekeeping because bees are easy to keep and don't require management. He also enjoys working with Honey Care because they don't destroy the honey combs while harvesting, allowing the colonies to produce even more honey. 

This is Matayo's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to start a maize selling business or open a small shop. In the future, Matayo hopes to purchase a motorbike that will help him transport his maize from his home to the market.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Raul Edgardo

texts.es:
Don Raul,tiene 40 años, es casado,tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia en la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Don Raul su negocio es un taller de ebanisteria donde hace muebles finos de madera, como puertas,roperos, closet, muebles de cocinaetc. Desde hace 5 años establecio este negocio al que le dedica tiempo completo, el cual ha crecido con la ayuda de Odef quien le ha financiado 2 prestamos anteriores los cuales ha pagado a tiempo. Su tercer prestamo actual es de 10000 lempiras, el cual solicito para comprar materia prima (madera), para elaborar los muebles y expandir el negocio a los alrededores para obtener mayor venta.
texts.en:
Raul is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives with his family in the city of Choloma, Cortes.

Raul's business is a woodworking shop where he makes fine wooden furniture such as doors, wardrobes, closets, and kitchen furniture.  He started this business five years ago and works there full time.  His business has grown with the help of Odef, which has financed his two previous loans, which he has repaid on time.  

His third loan is for 10000 lempiras.  He is requesting the loan to purchase wood to make furniture and expand his business to new areas to increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase materials (wood) to make furniture to sell.

loans.name: Shkelqim

texts.en:
Shkelqim is a 29-year-old married father of two children; one is five and one the other is one year old. They live in a village in central Albania, not very far from a main city. Residents of the village usually walk about an hour and a half from the village to the city and back to sell their agricultural/dairy products. They do this almost every day and “for older people this is too much” said Shkelqim.

Shkelqim is now requesting a loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek to buy four milk cows and goats from a good breed. He has a livestock business established already that he started about 10 years ago and wants to take the opportunity now from the integration project to add some more to it. He has nothing but good experience from this type of activity and is happy with the income he has been generating. He wants to thank all three organizations, VFA, KIVA &WVA for the opportunity to grow his business.

Shkelqim did construction seasonal work in Greece for long time, but now he will focus only on his livestock business in his homeland.

loans.use: To buy good breed goats and four milk cows

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, a 35-year-old mother of four children, is married to a farmer in Tala town. She grows cash crops such as maize, beans and vegetables. She has been in this farming business for the past five years and it has been profitable.

This is her third loan term with KADET Ltd., and she plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs. These include fertilizer and seeds. She anticipates making more income which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

Veronica hopes to grow more largescale cash crops and thereby become one of the leading farmers in the area. Hence, she will make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Abide

texts.en:
Abide is 44 and single. She lives in the village in the in southern part with her brother and father. Her family lives in a very poor conditions. To earn a living she works together with her brother selling wood. Up until now, they borrowed a trailer for selling wood.
 
It was very difficult for them to always borrow the trailer. For this reason, Abide is requesting a loan in order to buy a trailer for the tractor. This loan will help them to buy the trailer and in this way they can generate income for living. She is able to support her family through this business.  

She is hoping to stay in good health and to keep on making her own living in order not to ask for help from others. She appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a trailer

loans.name: Alexander Ivan

texts.es:
Alexander tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de choloma, Cortes.
Alexander tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion de camas, puertas, roperos, muebles de cocina,muebles de madera y otros.el utiliza madera de color para los trabajos, aparte de elaborar muebles hace colchonetas para cama y las vende. el proposito es aumentar sus ingresos.Lleva 3 prestamos con Odef los cuales le han ayudado mucho en el crecimiento del negocio. Actualmente solicita su cuarto prestamo de 15000 lempiras, necesita comprar material como esponja y telas para elaborar las colchonetas. El proposito es incrementar su inventario y que sus ingresos sean mejores.La meta que tiene es hacer el capital necesario, para el futuro darle su  hijo la educacion necesaria y estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Alexander is 30 years old, married, and has a son. He lives in the city of Choloma in Cortes province.

Alexander has dedicated himself to making beds, doors, wardrobes, kitchen furniture, wooden furniture, and other items. He uses colored woods for his products. In addition to making furniture, he also makes bed mats and sells them. His intent is to augment his income.

Alexander has had 3 loans with ODEF, and they helped him greatly in expanding his business.

Now he is requesting a loan of 15,000 lempiras, his 4th. Alexander needs to purchase materials like sponge and cloth to make bed mats. His proposition is to increase his inventory and to improve his income.

Alexander's goal is to have the necessary capital in the future to offer his son an education and economic stability.

loans.use: buy materials like sponge and cloth to make bed mats to sell.

loans.name: Paila De Agua Group

texts.es: Jacqueline, quien en la fotografía esta parada y es la cuarta de izquierda a derecha, es socia del Banco Comunal Paila de Agua, el cual está ubicado en la ciudad de Valdivia, Región de Los Ríos. Los socios de este Banco Comunal tienen distintos rubros, entre los cuales están la comida rápida, telefonía, bazar y paquetería, y justamente Jacqueline está dedicada a este último rubro, el cual lo comenzó hace más o menos tres años, ahorrando dinero del trabajo estable que tenía anteriormente para poder concretar su sueño y así además acceder al permiso Municipal para su bazar. Entre tanto ha tenido algunas dificultados como el hecho de tener que hacerse cargo sola del sustento de su hogar, lo cual ha sido difícil ya que le gustaría tener un poco mas de apoyo de los miembros de su familia, pero eso no da lugar a que ella no pueda  esforzarse por todas las cosas que quiere en su vida, es mas la alientan a seguir superándose. Jacqueline ocupará su crédito en poder comprar más insumos para su bazar y paquetería y está muy contenta porque como ha comenzado el periodo escolar está segura que tendrá mucha más venta. Está muy agradecida y feliz  de participar en Fondo Esperanza ya que le han enseñado muchas cosas pero lo que cree más importante en su vida es la Confianza, de poder aventurarse a concretar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, who is standing fourth from the left in the photo, is a member of Paila de Aqua Communal Bank, located in the city of Valdivia in Los Rios Region. The members of this communal bank engage in different activities, such as fast food, telephone service, and stationary and shipping store owner.

Jacqueline owns the stationary and shipping shop and began her business more or less three years ago by saving money from a previous job she had so that she could make her dream come true.  She obtained a license from the city to open her store. In the meantime, she has encountered a few difficulties along the way, such as having to take over sole responsibility for supporting her household. This has been difficult because she would have liked to have a little more help from other members of her family. However this does not mean she is not able to work hard for all the things she wants in life; rather it encourages her to continue excelling.

Jacqueline will use her loan to purchase more supplies for her stationary and shipping store. She is very pleased because the school year has started and she is sure she will have much more business. She is very grateful and happy to participate in Fondo Esperanza because they have taught her many things. She also believes that the most important thing in her life is to have the confidence to take risks so that she can make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her stationary store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been working as a van driver since 2001. His main road is between his town and the neighboring villages, transporting students to their schools. His business income is very important as he represents the only income source for his family.

Today, Mohammad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his van and pay mechanic fees. He states that these repairs will make his transportation safer and will help him attract more customers. This is his fourth Kiva loan and he hopes to be able to improve his business as well as the family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his van and pay mechanic fees

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a grocery store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Arlene successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her grocery store business.

NWTF is re-listing Arlene's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 57-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children. One is working and the other is still attending school. 

In 1990, in order to supplement the family’s income, he decided to start his own business as a farmer. He owns an orchard where he cultivates bananas and lemons. 

Today he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the required agricultural tools and supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers. He states that the loan will certainly help him increase his business productivity by a fair percentage, which will give him with higher profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and expand his orchard with a wider variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Dara

texts.en: Dara is 43 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than seven years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a teacher who makes an income of $3 each day. Due to lack of funds, Dara requests a loan of $500 to purchase an asbestos roof to build her house’s roof. This purchase will help her complete her house's construction. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn their bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase an asbestos roof to build her house's roof

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is married and the father of seven children. He is a fisherman and seaweed farmer from the town of Getafe, Bohol.

Juan wanted to upgrade his business but lacked the financial resources to do so. He is now applying for a 50,000 PHP loan from CEVI to buy more seaweed seedlings, fish nets, hooks and buckets. With these, he will be able to improve his fishing and seaweed farming business, thus augmenting his yield and profits.

Juan’s ambition is to sustain his business and ensure its success.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings, fish nets, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Ndanu

texts.en:
Ndanu has a grocery business in Emali town where she sells grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other vegetables and fruits. She is 24 years old and married with one child.

This will be her first loan term with KADET Ltd. and she plans to use the money to buy more stock of grocery items to sell. Since the demand from her customers is high, she anticipates generating more income with which she will buy more stock.

In the future, Ndanu hopes to grow her business and open a bigger grocery stall in the market. Thereby, she will make more income and be able to provide a good education when her child grows up.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and potatoes.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus owns a retail shop that he has been operating for the past two years in the town of Tala. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children.

This will be his second loan term with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of goods to sell in his business. These include sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, bread, as well as washing detergents among other items. He will use the generated income to pay for school fees for his children.

In the future, he hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Lenilia

texts.en:
Lenilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells nipa palm frond mats used for roofing and thatching. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now is applying for a new 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Lenilia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa to sell.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice lives in the town of Malava, located in Kakamega County. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area which provide bees with a variety of forage.

Loice is married and has five children. Her husband also farms, and they are currently growing sugarcane, maize and beans on their land. Loice is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because their hives are well made and produce a lot of honey. She is also looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as beekeeping "is not time consuming."

This is Loice's first loan, and she plans to use the income from her hives to feed her family and pay the primary school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Kadife

texts.en:
Kadife is fifty nine years old. She is married and has two grown up children, with one of them still attending university. They live in a village not far from a main city located in central Albania. They sell their agricultural products in the local market of this city. Some of the villagers have established a relationship with the city’s residents and they accept orders for their products and some others just sell in the city’s market. 

Kadife has been selling agricultural/livestock products for fifteen years and through this activity she has been able to support all of her family. With this loan, she wants to add another dairy cow to the existing herd and repair the stable. 

She is very happy that she has been granted such an opportunity to expand her activities.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow to the existing ones and repair the stable

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is a hard working 58-year-old single woman, who has been working as a tailor from her house for thirty years.
She works hard to make her living and to satisfy her customers.

She has a very good reputation, and is highly trusted and supported by her customers.

Claude is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to make necessary changes on her house for the winter season.

She is very happy with her business and hopes to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to make necessary changes on her house

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is married and has six children. The family lives in Malava, a small town in Kakamega County, which is located in western Kenya close to the Ugandan border. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates. The region also contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping.

Laurence has been farming for eighteen years and is currently growing maize and sugar cane. This is Laurence's first loan, 25,000 KES from Honey Care, and with it he will buy beehives. The income generated from his hives will help him to buy even more hives in hopes of securing a good income that he can use to educate his children.

Laurence likes working with Honey Care "because they deliver the hives right to your doorstep." He is excited to start beekeeping because it is a long-term project, and he loves eating honey! In the future he hopes to buy dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 49 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Liza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 24 years.

Liza requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su familia en la Ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
El tiene un negocio de pulpería. Hace 4 años la estableció y es ayudado por su esposa, con el  propósito de tener un trabajo propio y mejorar su nivel de vida para su familia. El vende productos de la canasta básica, como harina, arroz, frijoles, manteca, maseca, lácteos, etc. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa. Ha logrado mantenerse activo con los financiamientos que odef le ha proporcionado.
Actualmente ha solicitado su noveno préstamo de 22,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, etc. Mejorara sus ingresos y aumentara su inventario ofreciendo variedad de producto.
Espera seguir trabajando con los financiamientos  y mantener su negocio siempre surtido para obtener los ingresos que le faciliten el bienestar de su familia y sobre todo la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 34 years old, married, has three children, and lives with his family in the city of Choloma in the department of Cortes.  He has a grocery store that he established with his wife four years ago with the purpose of having his own business and mproving the life of his family.  In the store which is located in his house, he sells products such as flour, rice, beans, butter, corn flour, dairy, etc.  

Juan Carlos has succeeded in maintaining his business with the financing that ODEF has given him.  Currently, he is applying for his 9th loan of 22,000 lempiras (currency in Honduras) to invest in the purchase of food products such as basic grains, dairy, lunch meats, etc. that will improve his income and increase the variety of products that he offers.  

Juan Carlos hopes to continue working with ODEF and to maintain a well-stocked store in order to have the income to facilitate the well-being of his family and above all, the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy products such as basic grains, dairy, lunch meat, etc to sell in his store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 35, lives in Juba, Sudan. She has four children between the ages of two and twelve. She runs a general store and has been in business for the last eleven years. She has no employees.

Josephine heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is applying for a 3,000 SSP loan to buy charcoal to sell. Her ambition is to expand her store.

Josephine is grateful for the loans granted her by Finance Sudan with Kiva’s help.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en: Bernardina is a 53-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Bernardina is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, bread, biscuits, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this additional stock, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, bread, biscuits, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 31 years old and married with two children. She has a maize mill business in Tala town. She sells the flour to her customers within the town, and to hotels and schools as well. She also sells maize.

This is Jackline's first loan term with KADET and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of maize. This will enable her to have enough stock of flour to sell to her customers. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business by opening another maize mill business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize for her business.

loans.name: Rosas De Cristal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE CRISTAL”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por trece  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de cerrajería, tienda de barrio, venta de dulces, elaboración y venta de dulces, venta de cosméticos, cría y venta de chancho, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina da a conocer que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años atrás al observar la carencia de este negocio en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de enlatados y azúcar) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito, compartir con las compañeras y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The ROSAS DE CRISTAL Communal Bank will start its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Regional Office. It is composed of thirteen members and led by a board of directors with Sra. Cristina as president. The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are diverse and include a locksmith, neighborhood store, sales of sweets, the preparation and sale of sweets, cosmetic sales, the raising and selling of pigs and a book shop.

The loan the group takes out will benefit small business people such as Sra. Cristina. She notes that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago on invitation from a recruiter who visited her house. Currently she runs a neighborhood store that she started on her own initiative several years ago when she noticed the lack of such businesses in her area.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her inventory (by purchasing canned goods and sugar), which she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later re-sell in her store. This kind of work enables her to generate an income to support her household since she lives in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the training workshops on health and loans, sharing with her co-members and the savings.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and sugar.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke lives in Malava, a small town in Kakamega County located in western Kenya. The county is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old-growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Luke is married and has five children. The couple are both farmers, and they are currently growing maize, carrots, tomatoes and other vegetables on their land. Luke is an experienced beekeeper; he started beekeeping when he was young and says it is his hobby.

This is Luke's first Kiva loan, and he is applying for 25,000 KES through Honey Care to buy beehives. He likes that Honey Care guarantees a market for his honey. He plans to use the proceeds from his honey sales to pay the primary and secondary school fees for his children. He hopes to expand his apiary to a hundred hives in the future.

When asked about his hopes and dreams, Luke states that he wants to "see my children through school and become an expert in beekeeping."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of three children ages 14, 9 and 6. Magdalena lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. She earns a living through her sewing business. She has been in this venture for more than 20 years now. Magdalena works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially their children's school expenses.

As of now, Magdalena is applying for a loan to buy materials for sewing like cloth. thread, needles and other materials. With these supplies, Magdalena will be able to cater to and accept more orders and repairs from her customers. In the future, Magdalena hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing like cloth, thread, needles and other materials.

loans.name: Joyitas De Tarapaca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JOYITAS DE TARAPACA”  iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía en mantas, venta de pescado, venta de fruta, venta de ropa americana.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa da a conocer que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años atrás iniciando con un pequeño capital que en la actualidad creció por los prestamos obtenidos en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Joyitas de Tarapaca' (Gems of Tarapaca) will begin its nineteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata group of businesses. It is made up of eight members and headed by a board of directors with Rosa as the president. The businesses run by the members are varied, including shawl weaving, selling fish, selling fruits and selling American-style clothes.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microentrepreneurs. Rosa says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling clothes and she says that she started this business on her own initiative several years ago, after starting with a small amount of capital which has since grown because of the loans she has gotten from Pro Mujer.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital (by buying clothes) which she will get from wholesalers in the city of La Paz. After that she will sell them in her retail space. This type of work lets her generate resources to support her household as much as possible, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training sessions in health and loans, and the savings.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his employees.

loans.name: Resmije

texts.en:
Resmije is in her fifties. She was widowed long ago and has two children who are in their early twenties and attend universities.
 
“It has been very difficult for me to raise my children and educate them, all on my own,” she said. “I have had my little business in agriculture and livestock for all these past years and the work volume for me has been huge. I had to take care of my animals and plant the field and also sell the products. Not easy at all. But without it, I would have no income whatsoever. So, knowing this, it makes me work harder.” Resmije continued.

Resmije now wants to buy another cow and repair the stable with this loan.

loans.use: To buy another milk cow and repair the existing stable.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy lives in Kakamega town in western Kenya. Kakamega town is located in Kakamega county, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well-suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Emmy is married, and has five children. She works as a farmer, and her husband is currently employed as a pastor. She has been farming for 23 years, and is currently tending dairy cattle and poultry, and growing maize, soya beans and bananas on her land. She likes working with Honey Care because their hives are well-made and produce large amounts of honey, and she is is excited to start beekeeping because it is an easy project that is also profitable. 

This is Emmy's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to help pay for her children's college fees. In the future Emmy hopes "to see my kids live a comfortable life and to become a successful farmer."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo es casado y no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia ya que ambos padres fallecieron y el es el unico hijo, ocupa una habitacion con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicasa en la zona Chorolque de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente y trabaja en un taller de chaperia en el cual le pagan un sueldo semanal y con eso debe cubrir los gastos de alimentacion y pago de servicios basicos de su familia.
El credito lo requiere el mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que solo es de uso personal para trasladarse a su trabajo.
El sueño de Ubaldo es mejorar sus ingresos para independizarse en su trabajo y tener su propio y taller de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita credito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ubaldo is married and does not have children. He owns his house since both of his parents have died and he was their only child. He lives in a room with brick walls and a dirt floor. His house is located in the Chorolque area of the city of La Paz.

Ubaldo currently has a job in a bodywork shop where he earns a weekly salary, which he uses to cover the costs of food and basic services for his family. He needs a loan to service his vehicle, which he uses to get to his job.

Ubaldo’s dream is to increase his income and become self-employed. He wants to own his own shop so that he can improve his quality of life. This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPROV and the first time from KIVA.

loans.use: to service his vehicle, which he uses to go to work.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 35 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy goods like bread, laundry detergent, noodles, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

Leonila has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Leonila aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy goods like bread, laundry detergent, noodles, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Malava, a small town in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well-suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Mary is married, and has five children. She and her husband are farmers, and they are currently growing sugar cane and vegetables on their land. Mary is excited to work with Honey Care Africa, because she trusts the Hive Technicians to visit her farm regularly and do good work repairing the hives and harvesting honey. She also thinks that beekeeping is a good project, because it is profitable and does not require too much of her time. 

In the future, Mary hopes to see her children live a good life. This is her first loan, and she plans to use the income generated from her beehives to educate her children "to a good level."

loans.use: to buy beehives and to produce honey.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Don Pablo de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos se dedica a la agicultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol, ha obtenido buenas ganacias gracias a la venta de sus productos. Don Pablo solicita un credito para poder comprar mas insumos agricolas que le permitan cosechar mas de sus cultivos y asi porder siguir adelante con su esposa y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pablo, 56 years old, lives in his own home with his spouse and their four children. He has been working in agriculture for many years and his main crops are corn and beans. He has earned a good income thanks to the sales of his products.

Pablo is asking for a loan to buy more agricultural inputs, which will let him harvest more of his crops. In this way he will be able to move forward with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of five children. In 2009, she opened her own small bakery which specializes in the Lebanese traditional saj manakish, offering several toppings upon customer request. Fatima was the first to open such a bakery in her region, which earned her customer loyalty and support.

This is Fatima's seventh cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower; all of her previous loans where invested in supporting her business and family. Today she will use the loan to buy flour, oil and raw materials at good prices to increase her business capital and income, she will also use part of the loan to buy a living room for her house.

She is very proud of what she has, and will make sure to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil and raw materials at good prices to increase her business capital and income.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old from Jenin. He has owned a stationary shop since January 2012.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy stationary and school supplies for his shop. Mohammad hopes that this loan will help him increase his number of customers, thus increasing his sales and improving his income.

loans.use: to buy stationary and school supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Llamiletk

texts.es:
Llamiletk habita en el municipio del Sauce, un bello y encantador municipio, donde existen diferentes actividades Agro ecológicas.  

Llamiletk se llama el Joven de 45 años edad Luchadora por su vida y la de su familia, es una madre soltera, cuenta con dos hijos bajo su cargo, se dedica a brindar su servicios laborales en uno de los centro de enseñanza. 

Hoy en día se vio la necesidad de querer mejorar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita a kiva y Ceprodel que le financien un crédito para la compra de Zin, Madera y Pago de Mano de Obra, esto sería de gran importancia poder pasar un mejor invierno con más seguridad con sus dos hijitos 

Agradece a este tipo de personas que ayudan con crédito y que siempre piensan en las personas de escasos ingresos de darle la oportunidad de poder salir adelante a través de un crédito y poderlo pagar con cuotitas al alcance de su bolsillo.
texts.en:
Llamiletk lives in the town of El Sauce, a beautiful and charming town, where there are different agroecological activities.

Llamiletk calls herself the "Young One of 45 years old." She fights for her life and that of her family. She is a single mother with two children under her care, and she works offering her services at a school.

Lately she has seen the necessity of improving the roof of her home. For this reason she is asking Kiva and Ceprodel to finance a loan to buy zinc, wood, and to pay for labour. It is of great importance to her to be able to spend a winter with her two children in greater safety.

She is thankful to the type of people who fund loans and always think of people with low incomes. A loan gives them the opportunity to get ahead, and to pay them off in an affordable way.

loans.use: to buy zinc and wood.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, 42, is married with six children residing in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. Four of her children are dependents and still in school. To support her big family, Sokhom has been farming rice on three hectares of farmland for almost twenty years while her husband makes palm juice for extra income. The current business earns her family about 20,000 KHR per day to meet their needs.

Sokhom’s Group consists of three members who live in the same village and she is in her third microloan cycle with VisionFund. Sokhom completely repaid the loans with VisionFund and successfully used the loans to better support her family. She and her group members are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ma. Emejojefe

texts.en:
Ma. Emejojefe is 42 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising hogs in the Philippines.

She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Emejojefe has been in the hog-raising business for 14 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 21 times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Nelia
