texts.en:
Ma. Nelia is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she earns an additional income from raising pigs.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase more stock to sell at her general store, like biscuits, candies, noodles, snack foods and other groceries.

Ma. Nelia has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her general store, like biscuits, candies, noodles, snack foods and other groceries

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim is aged 38 years and widowed, and she has four children. Two of them are dependent on her and still in school. She lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. She earns a living by growing cassava, rubber trees and peppers on a 5-hectare area of farmland. To earn additional income, she also sells grocery items in her local area. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 30,000 KHR each day, after daily living expenses.

This is Thim’s microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she just joined with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She will use part of it to buy more peppers for planting, and another part to dig a well. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield from her pepper planting, so as to sell the crop for a good price.

loans.use: To buy more pepper seedlings for planting and to dig a well

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area of Ou Reang Ov district, Kampong Cham province, Kimleang is 39 years old and married. She has two children. She earns a living by farming rice, while her husband works as a paid construction worker to help better support her business. Together, they can earn about KHR 30,000 per day from the current business, and they can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Kimleang with VisionFund. She is now asking for a loan. Kimleang is going to use part of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland, and use another part to assist her child’s wedding. She hopes this loan will enable her to timely grow her rice, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland, and to assist her child's wedding

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Chayon

texts.en:
Chayon, 51, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. She is a married mother of six children, three of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. Her family’s income is from growing cassava, mung beans and soybeans on nine-hectare of farmland. She and her husband have been in this business for seven years.
Chayon has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she completely repaid the loan.  She has successfully used the loan to better support her living. Now applying for another loan of KHR4,000,000, she is going to buy more plots of land for her planting business. With this loan, Chayon hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business so as to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more plots of land for her planting business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 35 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs. Analyn has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from sinamay weaving.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business, making fishing nets, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Nenita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy materials for making fishing nets to sell. Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for making fishing nets to sell

loans.name: Hauda

texts.en: This is Hauda, 45 years old. She’s a Lebanese divorced woman living with her five children, four of whom are working and the other is still attending school. Despite all the bad things that she has gone through, Hauda was ready to start her own business to take on the responsibility of her family.  She has owned a crafts and accessories shop since 2010. And because she is a very friendly person, she has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today, in order to increase her sales, she decided to take a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase tools and supplies with added related accessories. She notes that this will definitely allow her to earn a superior income and therefore cover the family expenses. She is really ambitious and looks forward to better improve her business and grow in this occupation.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies with added related accessories

loans.name: Athiyan Dau

texts.en: Athiyan Dau is a 38 year-old businessman who lives in Juba.  He has six children between the ages of five and 18.   Athiyan runs a construction supplies business and has been in business for the last seven years.  He has no employees.  He heard about Finance Sudan through promotion by the officer.  He is taking 2000ssp to purchase more poles to resell.  He wants to expand his business.  His main challenge includes high transportation costs.   Athiyan says he is happy for the loans given him by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items, like poles

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil is 52 years old and is from Tulkarem.  He is married and has fourchildren, three of whom go to school.  He has owned a grocery store since 2008 and has one employee.  He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator, canned food, and some cleaning supplies for his grocery store.  He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, canned food, and some cleaning supplies for his grocery store.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en: Bahodur is married and has three children.  He has always wanted to provide them with a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that six years ago he began his own business as a driver. Thanks to good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. His children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. He is asking for a loan to buy new car.  In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income.  That will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man, aged 44, who lives at Kanagisa village with his three children and wife. So far two of his children attend various schools in Kooki.
He is a farmer who deals in raising cattle. He started farming in 1993 with six cows.  Now he has over 60 Ankole long-horned cattle (local breeds). He also grows plantain and maize, but on a medium scale. He sells his agricultural products to the local community, most especially fishermen from a Kanagisa fishing site and cattle traders from Kampala.

The reason why he started farming was for personal development, and for that reason he has managed to acquire several plots of land from the neighbouring trading centre and various bibanja around Kanagisa and the neighboring villages.  He has acquired this loan to buy more cows in order to increase the quantity of milk he supplies.  He hopes to expand his business to the level of supplying 1000 liters of milk every day and to take good care of his family with all desired materials.

Several of the challenges he faces are limited capital and unpredictable weather changes.  He describes himself as a humble and hardworking man.
He urges money lenders to take good care of their animals in order to reduce animal diseases.  This will help them to open up markets which were closed, and, as a result, there will be customers (clients) for the animals.  Therefore, there will be business growth.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbold, 33 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

Enkhbold and his daughter have been rendering transportation services since 2005, and have accumulated a vast amount of experience. The minivan he uses for business has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So, Enkhbold is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts, such as engine valves, fuel filter and coil wire. As a result, he can continue his transportation service without worrying about breakdowns. 

Enkhbold is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, such as engine valves, fuel filter and coil wire.

loans.name: Liliana Angela

texts.es:
La Señora Liliana vive en Quevedo (Ecuador), ella tiene 48 años de edad. Ella puso un cyber-barzar con un capital propio, por la necesidad que ella tenía y sabia que por medio de este negocio iba a ganar dinero, ya que hay una escuela al frente de su casa.

Ella tiene un bazar y un cyber en su casa, ella lo atiende todos los días, la única dificultad que ella tiene es que las calles están sin cementar y esto es  muy dificultoso para poder transitar, ya que cuando llueve se asen puro lodo. Ella no tiene esposo, tiene 2 hijos y estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar cuadernos, papeleria, plumas para su bazar ya que estan proximo la temporada escolar. Ella desea para más adelante terminar de construir su casa y incrementar su negocio, para poder tener mes ganancias.
texts.en:
Liliana, age 48, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  She set up a cybercafe-store with her own capital.  She did this out of a need that she had.  She knew that through this business she was going to earn money because there is a school in front of her house.

She has a store and cybercafe at her house, and she tends to it every day.  The only difficulty that she has is that the streets are not paved.  This makes it difficult to be able to go from place to place because when it rains, it becomes pure mud.

She does not have a husband.  She has two children, and they attend public school.

She wants to use the loan to buy notebooks, stationery items, and pens for her store because the school season is coming.  

She wishes to get ahead finishing the construction of her house.  She also wishes to increase her business in order to be able to have more income.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, stationery items, and pens.

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Hussam appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture next to his taxi.
Wafa is a 28 year-old woman, She is a mother who has one son and two daughters.  For the past five years, Wafa's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family.  Wafa is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives and paying the cost of licensing and insuring it. This will increase the taxi capacity to work extra hours and enable Wafa's husband to take additional requests, which will improve the family's income.

loans.use: To repair the taxi and pay the cost of licensing and insuring the taxi

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur is 34 and married. He has been in the agriculture/livestock type of activity for a long time. He sells dairy products. The financial support of his family depends on how he contains his animals and from milk and milk products sales.

Teymur has submitted his application to VFAC for a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase a head of cattle. Now that he is being told about the possibilities of borrowing from Kiva lenders, he is excited and wants to thank lenders in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a head of cattle.

loans.name: Ngumbao

texts.en:
Ngumbao lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married father of three school aged children. He owns a restaurant, which he has been operating for three years. He employs two other people in the café.  Ngumbao learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group.  He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and the effects of seasonsl changes. 
Ngumbao is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy stock, e.g. rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children and improve his living standard. His dream is to open another food cafe.

loans.use: To buy food stock e.g. rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Saidkhon

texts.en: Saidkhon is married and has three children.  He has always wanted to provide them with a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that two years ago, he began his own business as a driver. His wife is a housewife. His children are adults. His son is going to go Russia to find a job.  Saidkhon must buy an  airplane ticket for his son, but he does not have money for it. He is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy the ticket. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an airplane ticket for his son

loans.name: Robert

texts.ru:
Роберт родился 1955г. в селе Егвард (Yeghvard) Сюникской области . 
Сейчас Роберт живет  в городе Капан вместе с женой, двумя сыновьями и дочкой. Его дети уже взрослые и каждый из них имеет специальность и работу. Жена Роберта педагог и работает в школе интернате. 
Долгие годы роберт работал водителем. Уже 10 лет как он работает водителем такси в разнын такси сервисах Капана , а последние годы он уже водит свой собственный автомобиль и является частным таксистом. Как он признался  после покупки собственного автомобиля число его клиентов выросло и вместе с этим и вырос прибыль от такси сервиса . Роберт очень доволен тем, что он в эти трудные времена может достойно содержать свою семью. 
Кредит на сумму 500,000 Армянскин драм поможет Роберту сменить обивку своего нового автомобиля, починить некоторые технические неполадки автомобиля. Посли этин работ машина Роберта будет безопасной и очень комфортной для его клиентов.
texts.en: Robert was born in 1955 in the village Yeghvard in the Syunik Region.  Now, he lives in Kapan together with his wife, sons and daughters.  His children are already grown and each has a job for which they've studied for.  Robert's wife is a teacher and works at a boarding school.  For 10 years, he has worked as a taxi driver for various services in Kapan.  In recent years, he's been driving his own vehicle as a private driver.  He says the number of his clients increased after purchasing his own car as did his profits.  Robert is very happy that during these difficult times he is able to provide for his family.  A loan of 500,000 Armenian dram will help Robert change the upholstery in his new car and to make a few technical repairs.  After this work, his car will be safe and comfortable for his clients.

loans.use: To change his car upholstery of and to fix some technical problems

loans.name: Eid

texts.en:
Eid is a 60-year-old hardworking man. He is a father of six sons and daughters. Having a big, growing-up family led to his opening a small fruits and vegetables shop after his retirement.  He opened the shop because the retirement salary was not enough to support the family. 

Now Eid is applying for a loan in order to bring in more fruits and vegetables to increase his profits. That will help in providing a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ortukboy

texts.ru: Ортукбой трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 16,  14 и 10 лет. Он занимается скотоводством и земледелием. Он с детства помогал родителям по скотоводству и поэтому он имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу. Он занимается выращиванием крупно - рогатого скота. Он имеет землю, где выращивает картофель и пшеницу. В этом году он не смог получить хороший урожай и поэтому остался почти без средства для проживания. Его близкий друг работает в России, и он предложил ему хорошую работу. Он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию, но не хватает денег для покупки авиабилета. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1700 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Ортукбой ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ortukboy is a hardworking person.  He's married and is raising three children, aged 16, 14 and 10.  He works in agriculture and with livestock.  Growing up, he helped his parents with cattle breeding and in doing so, gained much experience in this business.  He has land where he breeds his animals, as well as grows potatoes and wheat.  This year, his crops were bad and he was left without means on which to live.  His close friend works in Russia and offered Ortukboy good work there.  He wants to travel to Russia, but he does not have the funds to buy a plane ticket.  He's asking for a loan of 1700 KGS to pay for his travel.  Ortukboy awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a plane ticket

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 33-year-old hardworking and supporting wife. She is a mother of two boys and two girls. 

While she is at home, Maha started a business by opening her home as a daycare for children with working moms, to help in bringing an additional income to the family. Her husband has an animal sales business, where he has a number of goats and sheep and chickens that are offered for sale. 

Now, Maha is applying for a loan to support her husband to increase the number of sheep he has.

loans.use: to increase the number of sheep.

loans.name: Nosheen Group

texts.en:
Nosheen is a 36 year-old housewife living in Rawalpindi with her husband and three children. Since 2005, her husband has been running a hardware shop. He has been selling the tools for plumbers, electricians, laborers and carpenters. Nosheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy new tools for his shop. The old tools are obsolete and there is no demand for them now.  After getting the loan, she will invest the money in her husband's business and he can buy new tools like drill machines, hammers, PVC pipes, joints, wiring, etc.  In this way, he can expand his business, and their monthly income can be increased. With the profit amount, Nosheen intends to pay her household expenses. She is looking forward for the bright future of her children. She is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for their support.
Note: In the picture Nosheen is raising her hand

loans.use: To buy new stock for the hardware shop

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is grateful for the first loan he received. The family is receiving much help and making great help. He aspires to grow the business from a local supplier to a commercial supplier. He has been able to venture into selling of building poles and charcoal, too, to diversify his income sources.

He is therefore asking for a loan of 41,850. He will use it to buy a fishing boat and a new batch of chicks.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and a new batch of chicks

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón es un bello municipio ubicado en el departamento de León, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras y ganaderas es aquí donde vive el joven Luis Acuña. 

 Luis Acuña es un Joven con muchos años de experiencia en la actividad ganadera, cuenta con un hijo a su cargo sus principales ingresos es la producción de leche, su hija estudia en la universidad, con tanto esfuerzo mantiene sus estudios.

 Hoy en día se le ha presentado una oportunidad de conocer a ceprodel y kiva que estos financian préstamo para cualquier necesidad que se le presenten a las personas luchadoras como es el caso de el joven Luis.

Debido a las condiciones que presenta en su finca solicita un crédito a ceprodel y kiva para la compra de: alambre, grapa y Pago de Mano de Obra, con esto mejoraría las condiciones de su finca y las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a pretty municipality located in the department of León, where there are many enterprising people who work in livestock. This is where young Luis Acuña lives.
Luis Acuña is a young man with many years of experience in livestock. He has one child under his care. His main income comes from milk production. His daughter studies in university, and maintains her studies with great hard work.
He now has the opportunity to get to know CEPRODEL and Kiva, as they finance loans for any need that presents itself to hard-working people like Luis.
Given the conditions of his farm, he is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL and Kiva for the purchase of wire and clips, and to pay the labourers. With this he will improve his farm's conditions and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wire and clips, and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Saira Group

texts.en:
Saira is a 35-year-old, hard-working woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two children. Her husband is a laborer, and his income is insufficient to meet the family's needs. Saira is trying to help him fulfill their needs, by stitching clothing. 

Since 2008 she has been operating her tailoring business very efficiently, but she is currently in need of purchasing a new sewing machine, as her old machine is not working properly. She has requested a loan as a member of a two-person group from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can continue her business by purchasing a sewing machine. Her production could be increased in this way, and with the profits she will pay the household expenses and can increase her monthly savings. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture, Saira is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single young man. For the past three years, Mohammad has been selling mobile phones and accessories. 

What distinguishes this project is that it is the only one in the area where Mohammad lives and has many loyal customers. This makes Mohammad’s project a profitable one. It is the only source of income for him, but he also needs more support to cover necessary costs.

Mohammad is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing different types of mobile phones and a new collection of accessories. Taking this loan will increase sales and improve the family's income, which will enable them to live in better conditions.  

Mohammad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Sodikjon

texts.ru: Содикджон хороший семьянин и успешный бизнес мен. Ему 55 лет. Он женат на прекрасной женщине.  Его жена работает в фермерском хозяйстве. Они имеют 4 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. Содикджон более 20 лет занимается скотоводством. Он имеет очень большое хозяйство, то есть 90 баранов, 10 козы и 1 лошадь. Его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса. Так как у него много скота это требует много усилия и упорного труда. Он собирается в этом году сыграть свадьбу своего младшего сына. Проведение свадебного торжества требует много денег и поэтому он должен развивать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему увеличить доход и осуществить мечту его сына.
texts.en: Sodikjon is a good family man successful in business.  He is 55 years old and married to a wonderful woman.  His wife works on a farm.  Together, they have four children who are all grown.  For more than 20 years, Sodikjon has bred cattle and has his own large operation of 90 sheep, 10 goats, and 1 horse.  His wife helps him conduct his business since he has many animals that require much work and attention.  This year, his youngest son will get married.  Paying for a wedding will require a lot of money that Sodikjon plans to earn by expanding his business to increase his income.  He's asking for a loan of 6,000 KGS to buy more cattle.  He  awaits your kindness.  The loan will help Sodikjon increase his income and to fulfill his son's dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is single and sells horticultural produce, e.g. tomatoes, onions, and vegetables. He has been operating this business for five years.

Patrick learnt about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to better his business operations. The main challenge he faces is price fluctuations. 

Patrick is applying for a loan of 52,300 Kenyan shillings to buy more fruits and vegetables. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the business and improve his livelihood. 

His future plan in five years time is to move to other, bigger income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kabayan Group

texts.en:
Larida is the featured borrower of Kabayan Group. She got along with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they are friends and consider themselves as one family, since they left their country. They left the Philippines and came to Lebanon for the same reason, which is providing their families back there a good standard of living.

Larida is the first one from the right, she is a 53-year-old, divorced woman, who works as a housekeeper. At the same time, she is a physiotherapist, and she does this as an additional income-making business. Part of Larida's loan from Al Majmoua will be sent to her family in the Philippines, to cover their needs. In addition, she will buy a special tool that will help her to provide physiotherapy services. The tool will help her to develop her physiotherapy business, and increase her income. She hopes that one day, she will open a special Physiotherapy center and improve her family's social and financial living.

Leticia is the one in the front, wearing red and a black jacket. She is a 52-year-old widow, who works as a housekeeper to raise her children and educate them. Her loan will be sent to the Philippines to pay her children's educational fees.

Gamma is the one with the brown jacket, at the right side of Leticia. She is a 44-year-old, married woman, who works as a housekeeper and sells CDs, to send money for her children's educational fees.

Juanita is the second one from the right, wearing a black jacket and hugging Leticia. She is a 44-year-old, married woman, who came to work as a housekeeper in Lebanon to provide for her family a better living.

Nelly is the first from the left, with the blue shirt. She is a 55-year-old widow, and she works in selling cosmetics to make her living. She hopes she can make a good profit that will help her start her own good business in the future.

Daisy is 54 years old and a married woman. She works as a housekeeper, to provide her children with the best living and higher education. Her share of the loan will be sent to the Philippines, for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy a special tool for use in her physiotherapy practice, and to send some money home to cover her family's needs

loans.name: Qasim Group

texts.en:
Qasim is a 42-year-old hardworking and diligent woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three daughters and two sons. Three of her children are currently studying in primary school. Qasim’s husband is an auto mechanic, and it’s really hard for them to meet the household and educational expenses.

Qasim is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By sewing clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past two years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Qasim is a member of a four-person lending group, and has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, Qasim will purchase a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently and her production can be increased. She can sew more dresses in less time with a new sewing machine. 

As Qasim is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams of building her own house. She also desires to increase her business and to provide a quality education to her children. One of her sons has an orange juice shop, and she will also invest a part of the profit amount in his shop. Qasim and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

Note: In the picture, Qasim is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 43-year-old responsible housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two daughters and two sons. Her husband is working in a wood shop. He has a very low salary, and it is very difficult for them to manage the household expenses; they are facing many problems in life. 

Since 2010, Zahida has been running a small general store to generate a second source of income for her family. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to buy a variety of goods like milk, sugar, rice, soap, detergents, creams, etc. She also wants to introduce some new items for her general store in order to fulfill the demands of the customers and to increase her savings. 

Zahida will reinvest the profit amount in her general store and use a part of it to pay her household expenses and for the education of children. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old, married man. He is a father to one son and two daughters. Mohammad is a laborer who earns a small salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN. He will use it to cover the cost of purchasing construction supplies, such as cement and sand. Taking this loan will enable Mohammad to complete building his house, and move into it with his family, soon. This loan will offer to Mohammad and his family a suitable home, so they can enjoy living in their house. 

Mohammad was photographed in front of his new, partially-built, house.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to complete building the house for his family

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Francis; he owns a mobile money transfer business in Nakonde district. His shop is located on the border of Zambia and Tanzania. The town where his shop is located is one of the biggest border towns in Zambia, with a high traffic of business taking place. This is his story....

My name is Francis. I am 25 years old. I have two brothers, and one sister. I started running my own business while I was in school. I had a camera that I would use to take pictures of people; then I would develop the pictures and sell them. This helped me to raise money to pay for my school fees. When I completed high school, I worked in a shop as a shopkeeper, and continued to take pictures in my spare time. Through my job and photography business, I was able to raise enough money to open my own mobile money transfers shop in Nakonde, a border town.

My mobile money transfer business gives me the pleasure to associate with different people. I enjoy the comfort of running the business without being answerable to anyone but myself. I have clear goals and expectations of what I want to achieve.  When it comes to my customers, I believe that they benefit from my business because it helps them send money to their distant relatives, such as children in schools, colleges, etc. They are also able to buy mobile phone airtime from my shop.

I am appealing to you, Kiva lenders, to help me with this loan. I will use the loan as the working capital float for my business. Currently, I have very little working capital, which slows down my transactions. My business is located at a border town, and as such the demand is very high, and sometimes I have to keep customers waiting because I have no cash to satisfy them. Once I get the loan, I believe that the growth of my business will be evident because I will have money readily available for my customers who want to receive money. This will help me to earn more commissions. The commissions are heavily dependent on how many customers I serve.

loans.use: To have enough working capital float so that he can serve all the customers who want to receive money from far-away senders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two beef cattle, two milking cows, and fodder

loans.name: Clemencia Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Clemencia vive en Quevedo (Ecuador), ella tiene 39 años de edad. Todo empezó cuando su esposo emigro a España ya que no encontraba futuro acá, al quedarse ella sola con sus hijos y sin dinero decidió ponerse un puesto de gorras y gafas, y por medio de este negocio a podido salir adelante.

Ella realiza las ventas con la ayuda de sus hijos durante todo el día. Las dificultades que a menudo se la presenta son las enfermedades que a veces impide trabajar con normalidad. Ella está casada su esposo esta fuera del país.  Tiene dos hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad, estudian en colegio particular.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio como: gafas y gorras. Ella desea para el futuro que su esposo regrese, y ponerse un almacén de ropa deportiva.
texts.en:
Clemencia lives in Quevedo, Ecuador, and she is 39 years old.  She started her business when her husband emigrated to Spain because he didn't see a future in Ecuador, leaving her alone with their children and without money.  She decided to start selling caps and sunglasses from a stand, and through this business she has been able to get ahead.

Clemencia makes her sales with the help of her children throughout the day. The difficulties she often faces are the illnesses that at times prevent her from working as she usually does.  Clemencia is married and her husband is out of the country.  She has children who are 17 and 14 years old who study in a private school.

Clemencia will use this loan to buy merchandise for her business such as sunglasses and caps.  In the future she wants her husband to return, and she would like to have her own sports clothes store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business: caps and sunglasses

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina es una mujer casada de 35 años de edad que de su matrimonio tiene una hija la cual es menor de edad y esta estudiando en la escuela. Junto a su esposo trabajan en la agricultura especialmente en el cultivo y siembra de café actividad que realiza hace más de 5 años ya que desde pequeña fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la agricultura misma actividad que hasta hoy en día siguen ejerciendo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completada cursada hasta el 2 grado y no pudo seguir estudiando ya que los ingresos que sus padres obtenían eran muy pocos y actualmente su esposo y ella son apoyo mutuo para salir adelante del cual depende su única hija. El cultivo de café queda a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación por lo cual se trasladan en carro particular hasta sus cultivos.

Adelina está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, bombas de fumigación para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya enfermedad que afecta especial mente esta clase de cultivo.  

Ella sueña con educar a su hija para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y con tanta contaminación ambiental y la falta de materiales para el cuido, las ganancias que quedan son pocas, pero de esta forma ella podrá preparar a su hija y podrá por medio de la solicitud realizada fortalecer su cultivo y tener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman who is 35 years old.  She and her husband have a daughter who is a minor and who attends school.  She works in agriculture along with her husband.  They produce mainly coffee.   Adelina has been doing this work for more than 5 years, because she learned how to farm from her parents when she was very young.  As a result, this is the type of work that she still continues to do now.  Adelina has a second grade education; she was not able to complete elementary school because her parents earned very little.  Now, she and her husband support each other so that they can get ahead with their dependent daughter.  Their coffee cultivations are located 2 kilometers from their house, and so they travel in a private car to get to their crops.

Adelina is requesting help so that she can purchase organic and chemical fertilizers and fumigation pumps to maintain her coffee crops.  If she doesn't provide this maintenance and care to her crops, they may get damaged over time by the Roya fungus, which particularly affects this type of crop.

Adelina dreams of educating her daughter so that she can have a better quality of life and better work opportunities, because working the land is so hard. There is so much environmental pollution and lack of supplies to care for the land, and the earnings are low.  In this way, she can prepare her daughter. Through this request, Adelina will strengthen her crops so that she will get an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and fumigation pumps to maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Nasreen Group

texts.en: Nasreen is 31 years old. She is a responsible mother of two children living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband is a government employee, and both of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household and educational expenses of their children, and they are facing many hurdles in life. Nasreen is helping her husband by selling clothing in her house; she has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. The main purpose of loan is to buy a variety of clothes at a cheaper rate and then sell them for a profit. In the future she is looking forward to opening a small boutique in the market. She would save some money from the profit and pay the educational expenses of her children. She has a bright vision and this loan could help her to fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support. NOTE: In the picture Nasreen is raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three cattle and one milk cow

loans.name: Marysali

texts.en: Marysali is married and lives in a rental house. She has been sewing clothes for more than 2 years and has gained much experience and recognition for her work thanks to her dedication and to the good service she provides. She will use the loan to buy supplies like fabric, thread, and elastic for her work. Thanks to this line of work, she’s been able to get ahead and help her family members cover expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, thread, and elastic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three cows.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимиру  28 лет .Он  женат и имеет сына и дочь . Жена Владимира домохозяйка и  воспитывает малышей. Владимир живет с семьей и родителями в городе Капан. Отец Владимира почти как 30 лет занимается ремонтом автомобилей в своем гараже.
 С 2008 года  Владимир и его отец открыли их частное дело по ремонту автомобилей. Они имеют постоянных клиентов в городе Капан. У Владимира тяжелая но прибыльная работа, которая позволяет ему достойно содержать семью.  
Владимиру нужен кредит на сумму 800,000 Арм. драмм для покупки авто-запчастей и инструментов для эго авторемонтной деятельности  .
texts.en:
Vladimir is 28 years old. He is married and has a son and daughter. Vladimir's wife is a homemaker and takes care of the little ones. Vladimir lives with his family and parents in the town of Kapan. For almost 30 years, Vladimir's father has been involved in auto repairs in his own garage. 

In 2008, Vladimir and his father opened their own private premises for auto repairs. They have regular customers in Kapan. Vladimir has a hard but lucrative job that allows him to support his family. 

Vladimir needs a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams to buy auto parts and tools for his auto repair activities.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts and tools for his vehicle repair activities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three calves and one milking cow

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, who appears in the picture, is a 22-year-old, single man. He is employed and earns a small salary, which is not enough to cover all his needs. Ahmad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN, which he will use to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ahmad to enhance his skills in using computers and to do his reports at home. This will ensure a better future for Ahmad and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед житель города Вахдат, расположенный в 20 километрах к востоку от столицы Таджикистана. Ему 32 года. У него есть жена, сын и две дочери. Хуршед занимается торговым бизнесом. У него есть собственный магазин, где он продает продукты питания, в том числе: печенье, сладости, шоколад, консервированные продукты, растительное масло, майонез, детское питание и т.д. Хуршед работает в области торговли в течение 5 лет. Он привозит свой товар в месяц 4 раза с города Душанбе. В бизнесе ему конечно помогает семья. Сейчас Хуршед запрашивает кредит для закупа продуктов питания в свой магазин с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Khurshed is an inhabitant of the town of Vakhdat, located 20 kilometers to the west of the capital of Tajikistan. He is 32 years old. He has a wife, son and two daughters. 

Khurshed is engaged in the trade business. He has his own store, where he sells food products, including cookies, sweets, chocolate, canned food, cooking oil, mayonnaise, baby food, etc. Khurshed has been working in trade for five years. He brings his goods four times per month to Dushanbe. His family always helps him in his business.

Now, Khurshed is requesting a loan to buy food products for his store with the goal of expanding inventory.

loans.use: to buy food products for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a food cafe. The business has been in operation for six months. 

Jumwa was introduced to Milango by her friends. She is asking for a loan of 15,900 Kenyan shillings. She will use it to buy food ingredients to use at her cafe, like sugar, baking flour, frying oil, and cereals.

A business challenge Jumwa faces is the high level of bad debts by her customers. Despite this problem, Jumwa believes she will have extra income earned with the loan. She will use her income to save for the education of her children, to provide a means of income to her employees, and eventually to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients to use at her cafe, like sugar, baking flour, frying oil, and cereals.

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.ru:
Вячеслав  - фермер. С 2008 года занимается выращиванием помидор, перца, лука и арбуза.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга и  19-ти летний сын. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания лука в открытом грунте.
Вячеслав решил приобрести пленку для защиты помидоров от холода и ветра.
В планах на БУДУЩЕЕ:  приобрести трактор с навесным оборудованием для вспашки и обработки  своего земельного участка.
В личных планах:  Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки.
texts.en:
Vyacheslav is a farmer. Since 2008, he has been involved in growing tomatoes, peppers, onions, and melons. 

He manages the farm with the help of his wife and 19-year-old son. 
Development of the activities began with growing onions in an open field. 

Vyacheslav decided to buy plastic film to protect the tomatoes from the cold and winder.

Plans for the Future: to buy a tractor with accessories for plowing and preparation of his land.
Personal Plans:  to finish building his home.

He needs help with financing the plastic film.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория  -  фермер. С 2010 года занимается выращиванием винограда.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж и 22-х летняя дочь. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания клубники а открытом грунте.
Виктория с мужем решила  приобрести мотоблок для вспашки и культивации своего земельного участка, т.к осуществлять вручную вспашку очень тяжело.
В планах на БУДУЩЕЕ:  посадить новые сорта винограда, ежевики, а также приобрести минитрактор.
В личных планах: достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования мотоблока.
texts.en:
Victoria is a farmer. Since 2010, she has been growing wine grapes.

Her husband and 22-year-old daughter help her to manage the farm. Development activities began with growing strawberries in an open field. 

Victoria and her husband decided to buy a push tractor for plowing and cultivating their land, since manual plowing is very difficult. 

Future Plans: to plant new varieties of grapes, blackberries, and to buy a mini-tractor. 
Personal Plans: to finish a house.

She needs help to fund the push tractor.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Antonio Maria

texts.es:
Don Antonio tiene 64 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y convive con su familia en el municipio de la Masica, San juan Pueblo.
Don Antonio hace 6 años inicio un negocio el cual consiste en la venta de mariscos(pescado y camarones), lo establecio con la necesidad de tener un ingreso en el cual solventar los gastos familiares. comenta que las ventas de estos productos son buenas y rentables, las ganancias que obtiene, las trabaja invirtiendo en producto.El ha realizado varios creditos con Odef que le han ayudado mucho a mantener activo su negocio. En la actualidad solicita otro de 10,000 lempiras para compra de mariscos (pescado) y aprovechar la temporada de Semana Santa, esta inversion le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos. La meta es seguir trabajando paa dar a su familia bienestar economico.
texts.en:
Antonio is 64 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives with his family in San Juan Pueblo in the municipality of La Masica.

Six years ago Antonio started a business selling seafood (fish and shrimp). He started this business out of the need to have a source of income with which to pay household expenses. These products sell well and are profitable. He invests his earnings into the purchase of more products.

He has had several loans with Odef which have helped keep him in business. He is currently requesting another 10,000 Honduran Lempiras to buy seafood (fish) and to make the most of the season around Holy Week. This investment will help increase his earnings. 

The goal is to continue working to provide his family with economic well-being.

loans.use: to buy seafood (fish) to sell.

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta comes from the town of Kisauni. She says she runs a small and well-furnished store in her neighborhood. She has three children, all of whom attend school, and whom she has succeed in educating thanks to her business.
 
She has been running her small store for several years. She has established customers, and she is really well-known thanks to the variety of products she offers to her customers. She wants to keep on investing in her activity. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, canned foods, bulk items, and other merchandise, in order to continue offering her customers a good variety of products.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, canned food, bulk items, and other merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Amazonas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAZONAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bertha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carteras, tienda de barrio, venta de carne, impresión cerigráfica, taller de carpintería, tienda de venta de carne, venta de ropa de bebe, taller de reparación de frenos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Bertha da a conocer que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de venta de pasteles; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por el concejo de sus profesores y sus amigas, iniciando con un pequeño capital que en la actualidad creció por los préstamos obtenidos en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en cercanías de los colegios. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amazonas” will be starting their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer through the regional office in Senkata. The group is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors with Bertha as the president. The members are engaged in various business activities such as hand bag sales, a neighborhood store, meat sales, screen printing, carpentry, a butcher shop, children’s clothing sales and a brake repair shop. 

The loan will benefit small businesses like Bertha’s.  She has been member of Pro Mujer for 2 years and was invited by a friend of hers who is a member. She currently sells pastries and she says that she started this business several years ago on the advice of her teachers and friends. She started with a small amount of capital which has now grown because of the loans through Pro Mujer.

With this new loan she will increase her capital and purchase flour from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will then sell her pastries in the neighborhoods around schools. This work will allow her to generate income to maintain her household as much as possible as she lives with her partner and their four children.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the meetings about credit and health.

loans.use: purchase flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three beef cattle, one milking cow, and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of maize flour and soft drinks, and also to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline est une femme de 51 ans , mariée et mère 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 19 et 32 ans. l'un d'eux va encore à l'école.Elle a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'elle a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 51 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children who are between 19 and 32 years old. One of her children is still in school. 

She opened a grocery in an area of the capital, which she has run for 2 years. Her small business works due to the warm welcome she gives customers, her experience in her field, and the clientele she has built over time. 

This last part is becoming important because she no longer can meet the needs of her customers. Due to her small amount of capital, she has to buy at retail prices. She is asking for a loan to strengthen her business in order to diversify her goods (rice, salt, mineral water, sugar, candy...) and increase her profit margins. 

She will reinvest a part of her profits in her business to cover its needs.  The other part will allow her to meet her daily needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to bolster her supply of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four cattle and one milk cow.

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en:
Hilder is a 49-year-old mother from Kisumu city; she is married to Clement, and has two children who are 24 and 26.

She has been in the tailoring business for the past 12 years, and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 14,000.  She is applying for her fifth loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase clothing material and repair some of her sewing machines. 

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees and boost her business. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business, and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material and repair her sewing machines.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan, age 22, studies at State Engineering University of Armenia. Together with his studies, he works at a local computer store, as a seller. Vardan lives with his parents and sister and, jointly with them, works hard to sustain their family.

Unfortunately, Vardan's salary is hardly enough for covering daily costs, and it is very difficult for him to save money for education. So Vardan has applied for this loan, which he will use to pay his university tuition. This is very important for Vardan, to be able to get a higher education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay his tuition at the Engineering University

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 35 years old and is a single man, as he has yet to get married. He is a farmer.

Elias has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to enable him buy a cow. He is optimistic that his business will do better, after the loan. 

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is married and has four children. Two are adults and working, while two still attend school. Halima has had a home-based grocery store for about seven years. Aside from the usual grocery items, she also has a vegetable stall that generates extra income, especially on the weekend. She’s requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, flour and noodles, at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour and noodles, at wholesale.

loans.name: Ingrid Geoconda

texts.es:
La clienta Ingrid vive en Orquídeas, ella tiene 43 años de edad. Ella empezó con la idea de su mama, ella les entregaba comida a unos amigos que laboraban en una empresa, y así comenzó con su propio negocio. 

Ella trabaja en un restaurante junto a su mama, una señora de edad ella le ayuda por la mañana y por la noche trabaja ella sola. Ella no a tenido ninguna dificultad en su trabajo gracias a Dios.

Ella no tiene esposo, no tiene hijos .Ella usara el préstamo para comprar inmuebles para su restaurante como: sillas,, mesas, y víveres. 

Su sueño es que Dios mantenga a su madre con vida, que siga con ella y que su negocio siga creciendo, y tener un lugar propio para establecerse.
texts.en:
Ingrid, age 43, lives in Orquídeas.  She started with her mother’s idea.  She delivered food to some friends who worked at a company.  That is how she started with her own business.

She works in a restaurant together with her mother, an elderly woman who helps her in the mornings.  In the evening she works alone.  She has not had any difficulty in her work, thank God.

She does not have a husband, nor does she have any children.

She will use the loan to buy things like tables, chairs, and supplies for her restaurant.

Her dream is for God to continue giving her mother life, that she stays with her, that her business continues growing, and to have her own place in order to establish herself.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en:
Hussam is a 22-year-old, single man. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is barely enough to cover all his needs.

Hussam wants to improve his skills in using computer applications, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. He will use it to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. Taking this loan will help Ahmad to get a new laptop and enhance his skills in using computer and internet applications.

Hussam appears in the picture, inside the store from where he purchased the laptop.

loans.use: To buy a laptop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 34 years old, is married, and lives in Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. Theresa has four children, 5 to 14 years old, who are in school.

Theresa runs a table in the community market, where she sells slippers, hair oil, water, and soft drinks. She works at her business for nine hours daily. She gets her goods from the capital city of Liberia, by riding a bus to go and come back. She enjoys her business, because it makes her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more slippers, hair oil, water, and soft drinks, to resell at her business table. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more slippers, hair oil, water, and soft drinks, to resell at her business table in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 44 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his 28-year-old wife, Lusiana. Tamaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Tamaz’s wife, Lusiana, is working at the local shop as a seller, and she earns a small daily income. This is the only source of income for the family now.

Recently, Tamaz requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit, with soft conditions, to poor people who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Tamaz will purchase a car to drive as a taxi. He had a car before, but after an accident it was totally damaged, and he had to stop working. With the new car, he will continue his work and earn additional daily income for the family. With the increased income, Tamaz and his wife will be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a car, to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Antony Muturi

texts.en:
Antony is 26 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is married and has one child, who is in school. Antony has a second-hand clothing business that he has been running for the past one year.

He has applied for his second loan from Kadet Ltd. He will use the loan to buy more clothes, to add to his stock to be sold.

He hopes to be able to open up a supermarket, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to add to his inventory

loans.name: Liliana Nicolasa

texts.es:
La Clienta Liliana vive en Quevedo, tiene 26 años de edad. Su papa también vendía CD pero en los transportes, cuando ella creció se puso un stand pequeño en una mesa de madera con unos cuantos CD, pero luego con un  crédito bancario logra tener su negocio propio y ahora tiene un gran negocio.

Ella realiza la venta de CD  sola, todos los días de la semana. A tenido inconvenientes en su negocio por medio de los ladrones. No está casada, no tiene hijos.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar CD para ponerlos a la venta en su negocio. Ella desea más adelante tener su casa propia y dejar de arrendar porque esto se le lleva mucho dinero.
texts.en:
Liliana, age 26, lives in Quevedo.  Her father also sold CDs, but he sold them on vehicles providing transportation.

When she grew up she set up a small stand on a wooden table with some CDs.  However, after that, with a loan, she managed to have her own business.  She now has a great business.

She sells CDs alone every day of the week.  She has had some obstacles in her business because of thieves.

She is not married, nor does she have any children.

She will use the loan to buy CDs in order to sell them at her place of business.  

Later she wishes to have her own house.  She wishes to stop renting because this takes a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy music CDs and movies.

loans.name: Knowe Favour Group

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Lemmy from Harare. He is single, but looks after his two brothers and one sister. Lemmy is in the poultry business, selling chickens. The business has been in operation for 5 years. He says the main challenges that he faces are that normally the chicks are affected with bird flu and weather. Also, if the chicks are not properly bred, they die. Lemmy has requested a loan of $500 to purchase more chicks and stock feed. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to send his brothers and sister to school and college. In the future, Lemmy plans to have a butchery in Norton.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks.

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: Don Luis de 30 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y maicillo, es un hombre responsable y trabajador con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus cultivos logra cubrir los gatos de su hogar, él solicita un credito para comprar mas insumos agricolas: semillas abonos, entre otros productos que el necesita para su siembra y asi poder llevar lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: Luis is 30-years-old and lives with his wife in his own home. He works in agriculture in the cultivation of corn and gamagrass. He is a responsible and hard workingman with the desire to cover the costs of his home through the sale of his crops. He is requesting a loan to purchase more agricultural supplies: seeds, fertilizer, and other products that he needs to harvest. This way he will be able to provide the necessities for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
Julia Mercedes de 34 años de edad, casada con tres hijos menores de edad. De 4, 8,12,  es originaria de  León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de tiempo de calidad con sus pequeños hijos. Preparándoles uno de los platillo típicos de la localidad como es la ‘ sopa de leche” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante Julia tiene por actividad económica servicio de costura y venta de ropa elaborada por ella misma. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, y dedica unas 8 horas diarias a su actividad  como es la elaboración de prendas de vestir como camisas, faldas,  short, ropa de cama, uniformes de colegios. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de materia prima como tela, forros, esponjas, encajes, hijos, aceite de máquinas, agujas, cintas de mantequillas, zíper; para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Julia Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Julia Mercedes is 34 years old. She is married with three young children. They are 4, 8 and 12 years old. She is originally from Leon, which is located in the west area of the country.  In her free time she likes to enjoy quality time with her small children by preparing them a typical dish of the area such as “sopa de leche” (milk soup). 

Unfortunately, due to lack of financial means, she was not able to study a university career. She felt obligated to work from a young age.  Currently she works hard everyday to give her family a better future. 

Thanks to her sprit and her drive to get ahead, Julia she has a sewing business and she sells clothing that she creates.  The business is located in her home and she works 8 hours a day in this activity such as creation of clothing such as shirts, skirts, shorts, sleepwear, and school uniforms. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in capital for work and supply the business with the purchase of materials such as fabric, linings, sponges, laces, thread, oil for the machine, needles, measuring tape, and zippers. She needs these items so that in the near future she could have better income. Julia Mercedes is grateful for the help that the investors in Kiva provide the people of scanty resources  and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a better means of honest work.

loans.use: to invest capital in the business for materials including fabric, linings, sponges, laces, thread, oil for the machine, needles, measuring tape, and zippers to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Melvil Eliseo

texts.es: Melvil se dedica a la siembra de maiz y frijol desde hace 15 años y ha logrado salir adelante junto con su famila ya que las ventas de sus cosechas le ha dejado ganacias para cubrir todos sus gastos, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, Don Melvil solicita un credito para poder comprar mas semillas, fetilizantes, abonos y todo lo necesario para el cultivo y asi obtener mejores ganacias que le ayuden a solventar los gatos de su hogar y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Melvil has worked harvesting corn and beans for the last 15 years. He has been able to get ahead with his family since the sales of his crops have generated income that cover his expenses. He lives with his wife and his two children in their own home. 

Melvil is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds, fertilizer, manure, and all the necessities to harvest. This way he will be able to obtain better earnings that will help him to cover the costs of his home and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new electrical installation for his home

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Víctor tiene 53 años de edad, está casado y es padre de 5 hijos, vive en una aldea de Esparta Atlántida, San Juan Pueblo.
Don Víctor  hace muchos años que  desarrolla sus habilidades en artesanías en madera. El ha recibido capacitación con una asociación Francesa quienes le han apoyado en la promoción y mercadeo de productos.
El tiene su propio taller de artesanías en madera como ser tallados, lápices, lapiceros, carritos, fruteros, llaveros etc., también  elabora muebles artesanos para sala, comedor, divisiones y otros con madera y mimbre. Este negocio lo comenzó con fondos propios y lo ha mantenido con los préstamos solicitados a ODEF, con los cuales ha podido hacer crecer el negocio y aumentar su clientela.
Actualmente solicita el doceavo  préstamos  que es por  25,000 Lempiras, para comprar madera y accesorios que utiliza en la elaboración de las plumas.
Su meta es tener más variedad de productos para atraer más clientes y también lograr exportar estos productos  que hace, para promocionarse e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Víctor is 53 years old. He is married and the father of 5 children. He lives in the town of Esparta Atlántida, San Juan Pueblo.

For many years, Víctor has been using his abilities making artisanal wood crafts. He received training from a French association who helped him with selling and marketing his products.  He has his own woodworking workshop where he makes carvings, pencil holders, carts, fruit bowls, key chains, etc.  
He also makes artisanal furniture for living rooms, dining rooms, bedrooms and more out of wood and wicker. He started this business with his own money and has maintained it with loans from ODEF, with which he has been able to grow his business and increase his clientele.

Right now, he is asking for his twelfth loan, which is for 25,000 Lempiras, to buy wood and accessories he will use to make fountain pens. his goal is to have a wider variety of products to attract more customers and also export the products he makes to sell more an increase his income.

loans.use: to buy wood and accessories to make fountain pens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fence the nursery school compound

loans.name: Tagarika Group

texts.en:
Mornica, age 42, is from Harare. She is married and has three children, all attending school. She also takes care of two additional dependents. Mornica is engaged in buying and selling of packaging materials for agricultural produce, such as potatoes, oranges and tomatoes. She imports from neighbouring countries. Her business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges she faces are import duties, and change of seasons for her products.

Mornica has requested a loan of $500, which she will use to buy more packaging to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's cash flow and improve the quality of life for her children. In future, Mornica wishes to be one of the big providers of packaging materials in town.

loans.use: to buy more packaging for agricultural produce, to resell to her customers

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa Fernanda , nació el día 20 de agosto de 1990. Su madre se llama María y su padre Luis. A la edad de 7 meses, sus padres se separan y su madre toma la decisión de mudarse, donde vive la familia materna (abuela y tíos), allí curso los estudios de educación básica primaria y secundaria en la Institución Educativa María Auxiliadora, en el año 2008 recibe el título de Bachiller Académico.
En el año 2009 por causa de traslado de sitio de trabajo del padrastro y con el ánimo de estudiar en la Universidad, nuevamente se mudan a esta ciudad, Donde inicia estudios de Medicina en la Fundación Universitaria San Martin, y simultáneamente hace curso de Ingles en Academia de idiomas Passport, que se ven interrumpidos debido a su embarazo. 
El día 11 de abril ingresa a la clínica Federman en trabajo de parto de su hija Zaray, quien en la actualidad tiene dos años de vida y asiste al Jardín Infantil Luz Del Mañana.
Por diversos motivos que no cabe mencionar no convive con el padre de Zaray;  pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para dar todo el amor y educación a su hija, de quien se siente muy orgullosa y da la vida por ella.
Le encanta la rama de la salud, en una de sus metas es llegar a ser médico, pero por tiempo y dinero esta meta se aplaza temporalmente sin dejar de darle prioridad. Por gusto al sector de la salud estudia auxiliar en enfermería en la Institución  CampoAlto; donde demuestra que la ayuda, atención y cuidado de los prójimos es su pasión.
En la actualidad sueña con ser una muy buena enfermera, dar un buen ejemplo a su hija, seguir valorando a su madre y su abuelita,… Se siente muy agradecida con Dios por contar con la educación y valores que le inculco su madre, que la llevaron a ser como es hoy una buena persona, de muy buenos sentimientos  y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Quiere trabajar y ahorrar para comprarle una casa a su princesa como llama a su hija y a su mama, darles lo que necesitan y no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Luisa Fernanda was born August 20th of 1990. Her mother's name is María and her father is Luis. When she was 7 months old, her parents separated and her mother decided to move to where her mother's family lives (grandmothers and aunts and uncles). She went to primary and secondary school there at  Institución Educativa María Auxiliadora. In 2008, she received her high school degree.

In 2009, because her step father had to move for work and because she wanted to go to college, they moved to this city again, where she began to study  medicine at the Fundación Universitaria San Martin. At the same time, she studied English at the Passport Language Academy, all of which was interrupted by her pregnancy. 

On April 11, she entered the Federman to give birth to her daughter Zaray. Now she is two years old and goes to the Luz Del Mañana day care. For reasons not to be mentioned here, she does not live with Zaray's father. This has not been an obstacle to giving all of the love and education she can to her daughter, of whom she is very proud and for whom she gives her life. 

She lives the area of health. One of her goals is to be a doctor but for reasons of time and money, this goal is being postponed temporarily, while still being a priority. Because she likes working in health she is studying to be a nurse's assistant at the Institución CampoAlto. there she has shown that help, attention and care for others is her passion. 

Right now, she dreams of being a good nurse, being a good example to her daughter and continuing to value her mother and her grandmother. She is very grateful to God for having education and values that her mother gave her, which made her the good person that she is today, honorable and eager to get ahead.

loans.use: to finish her degree in assistant nursing with Campoalto

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Elizabeth from Harare. She is a divorcee with one child who is attending school. Elizabeth runs a flea market business selling shoes, blankets, ladies clothes and accesories. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are the limits on quantities of goods at the border post and competition with other sellers. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of $500 to buy dresses and blankets for the winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's cash flow and quality of life. In the future, Elizabeth plans to have her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase products for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace from Nakuru is 58 years old. She is married with five children who are aged between 30 and 22 years old.

Grace has a farming business which she has been doing for many years. She has applied for this second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to be able to buy another dairy cow in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ruth Damaris

texts.es: Doña Ruth vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo tiene 5 años de tener una minitienda dentro de una escuela cerca de su lugar de residencia vende los 5 dias de la semana, es una persons responsable y trabajadora con las ganacias que le quedan de sus ventas ayuda a su esposo a los gastos de su hogar. Ruth solicita un credito para poder surtir su minitienda con golosinas, gaseosas, jugos y galletas ya que en la escuela donde esta tiene mucha demanda y asi obtener mejores ganacias para ayudar en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ruth lives in her own home with her child and husband. For 5 years, she has had a small store inside a school near the place where she lives. She is open 5 days a week, and she is a responsible and hardworking person. With the income from her sales, she helps her husband with the household expenses. 

Ruth is requesting a loan to stock her store with candy, soft drinks, toys, and cookies, because there’s a lot of demand in the school where she is located, and therefore she can obtain better earnings in order to help out in her home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Vision Ladies Group

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Ester from Harare. She is a divorcee with one child aged 20 years. She also looks after her sister's two children, as the sister has suffered a stroke. 

Ester is into buying and selling traditional foods like dried vegetables, beans, groundnuts, etc. The business has been in operation for 12 years. She says the main challenges faced are stiff competition in the market and seasonality of products. As part of the group, Ester has requested a loan of $400 to buy more stock for resale. 

She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's cash flow and quality of life. In the future, Ester sees herself owning a farmer's market selling agricultural products.

loans.use: To buy dried vegetables, beans, and groundnuts for sale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a mother and a resident of Kitale, in Western Kenya.  She lives with her family of two children, ages 2 and 11 years old.  She has been in the farming business for seven years and runs her farm with the help of one farmhand.  Her farm produces maize horticultural products and poultry.  In addition to farming, she also runs a salon business.  

Hellen has requested a loan of 62,400 KES in order to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She hopes to expand her farm and have at least five dairy cows in the future.  She reiterates that the additional dairy cow will improve her farming income through improved milk sales.

She points out animal disease and the high cost of feed as her major challenges.  She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
