Beatrice sells clothing for women and children, such as blouses, shorts, undergarments, t-shirts, and sweatshirts.  Little by little she began increasing her sales since she goes out herself to offer products in the zone.

One of her great dreams is to have her own store in the city center.  She is asking for a loan to purchase more women and men’s clothing.  This will help her greatly with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Achuapa Un Pequeño Pueblo, donde existen diversas actividades comerciales, es aquí donde habita la joven Alba Luz de 63 años de edad.

Alba Luz es una madre soltera, trabaja brindando servicio a los ciudadanos que habitan en el municipio, dicho negocio consiste en procesar el maíz con en masa con un molino para luego poder elaborar las tortillas para la venta,  cuenta con un hijo bajo su cargo, a duras penas ella mantiene su hogar, pero también ve de gran Necesidad, mejorar su vivienda, por tal razón solicita un financiamiento a Kiva Y Ceprodel para la compra de: Cemento, ladrillo y Arena, con esto cubriría parte de su necesidades. 

Cuenta con una buena salud, su honestidad y su buen record crediticio que le han ido mejorando las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a small town where there are various economic activities. This is where the young Alba Luz, 63 years old, lives.

Alba Luz is a single mother, providing services to the citizens of her town through her business of grinding corn that she can later make into tortillas to sell. She has a son in her care, and works hard to maintain her household. She sees a great need to improve her house, which is why she asks Kiva and Ceprodel for a loan to buy cement, brick and sand. This will cover part of her needs.

She has good health, honesty and a good credit record which has improved the stat of her business.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.fr: Jean Baptiste est un homme de 40 ans , marié et père 3 enfants . deux  vont encore à l'école.Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'elle a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is a 40-year-old man, married and father of three children, two of whom are still in school.

He opened a grocery store in one of the capital's neighborhoods and has already been managing it for two years. His small store is successful thanks to his warm welcome, his experience in the business and the customer base he acquired over time.

The latter is increasing in size; he is no longer able to satisfy customer demand and his limited funds force him to buy retail.

He is requesting this loan to bolster his small business, to diversify its goods (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, candy, ...), and to increase his profit margin.

He will reinvest a portion of his earnings in the business to cover the needs of his activity, and the remainder will allow him to meet his daily needs and those of his family.

loans.use: Increase his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sandra del Socorro de 45 años de edad, casada, con hijos mayores de edad  e independiente económicamente. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Sandra se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal, la cual ha tenido que luchar muy duro en la vida  para poder sobrevivir a pesar de las muchas adversidades. 

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de CD Y DVD regrabables. Actividad que la desempeña desde hace 8 años en un lugar específico de su localidad. Ella dedica a su negocio aproximadamente unas 10 horas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de CD Y DVD que se lo están ofreciendo a precio especial para luego poder  comercializarlo. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Sandra agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sandra del Socorro, 45, is married with grown children who are financially independent. She is originally from Leon, in the western part of the country. Sandra is hardworking, responsible and has a desire for personal growth. She has had to fight hard in life to survive in the face of many adversities. 

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead, she sells rewritable CDs and DVDs. She has been doing this for 8 years in her town. She spends around 10 hours on her business.

The goal of the loan is to invest in the purchase of CDs and DVDs that are at a special price in order to later sell them. This will give her more income in the near future. Sandra is grateful for the Kiva investors that give to people with limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have honorable work.

loans.use: to buy rewritable CDs and DVDs for resale.

loans.name: Fatanamunda Group

texts.fr:
Victor  fait partie du groupe Fatanamunda et   habite à Makamba. Il a  47 ans et est marié à Nsengiyumva, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de  6 à 17 ans.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (savons, riz, haricot,…)   depuis 30 ans. 

Il  est à son  quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (savons, riz, haricot,…) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années,  il voudrait devenir un commerçant grossiste.
texts.en:
Victor is part of the Fatanamunda group and lives in Makamba. He is 47 years old and is married to Nsengiyumva, a farmer. Together they have five children, whose ages range from 6 to 17 years.

He has been managing a general store (soap, rice, beans, ...) for the past 30 years. This is his fourth credit loan with Turame.

With the KIVA loan he obtains, he will increase his capital and buy many items for his store (soap, rice, beans, ...), to resell and earn more.

In coming years, he would like to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: it will increase its capital and buy many items from his shop (soap, rice, beans, ...) to sell to earn more.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr: Agnès est une femme de 43 ans  mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (plantains, bâton, bananes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 7 ans. elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter en gros les régimes de plantains, bananes, et les sacs de batons pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agnes is a 43-year-old mother. She is a retail merchant of fresh food (plantains, cassava sticks, bananas), depending on the season. She has been offering her goods at a local market for the past seven years.

She has a good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of the customers she has acquired over time thanks to her business experience. However she finds herself constantly out of stock because she is forced to sell all of her stock before she can resupply, due to her limited funds.

She wants to buy wholesale plantains, bananas, and bags of cassava sticks to establish a good stock supply. This will enable her to better meet the continuing customer demand and avoid being out of stock.. She will save her profits not only to expand her business activity but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Félix Arnulfo

texts.es:
El Sauce, es un Pequeño Pueblo con muchas características agroecológica, es aquí donde habita la joven Félix Arnulfo. 

Félix Arnulfo tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo, su esposa trabaja en una pequeña pulpería, con lo poco que ella gana ayuda en el sustento diario de su familia. 

Félix Arnulfo cuenta con su propia actividad donde consiste en una pequeña talabartería, labora albarda, monturas, cabezadas entre otros que ayuda de mucha importancia a la presentación de los caballos sauceños.  

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de: Baquetón, tiras de suelo, estribos, tejuelo, Acido, Nelina, Mecates y tules, esto será de gran importancia ya que podrá  elaborar más albardas que le será útil  para el crecimiento de su negocio  le permitirá permanecer estable y con buenos ingresos en su hogar.   

Agradece al gran Dios todo Poderoso, por haber conocido a Kiva y Ceprodel ya que son de sus sueños que estos le financien el crédito para poder vivir en mejores condiciones con en su vida.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a small town characterized by its agriculture and ecology; this is where Félix Arnulfo lives.

Félix Arnulfo has two children to care for; his wife works in a small grocery store. She helps with the family's daily expenses with the little bit that she earns.

Félix Arnulfo has his own business, which is a small leather workshop where he makes packsaddles, saddles, and halters, among other items that are important for showing horses in El Sauce.

For that reason, he applied for a loan to purchase tanned leather, cowhide strips, stirrups, saddle trees, acid, cords, and tulle. This purchase will be very important, because he will be able to make more saddles, which will be beneficial for the growth of his business. It will allow him to remain stable, with good income for his household.

He thanks the great and all-powerful lord that he learned of Kiva and Ceprodel, since it is a dream come true that they are financing the loan that will enable him to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tanned leather, strips of cowhide, stirrups, saddle trees, acid, cords and tulle.

loans.name: Jeanne Pulcherie

texts.fr: Pulcherie st une femme de 48 ans, mariée  mère de 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 25 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate, oignons, huile raffinée...) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place quelques mois. elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant en gros pour pouvoir mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Pulcherie is a 48-year old woman, who is mother to eight children ranging from 12 to 25 years old. She is a trader and has for the past few months been selling on a retail basis various types of fresh food (tomatoes, onions, refined oil) depending on the season, in a local market. She knows her suppliers well and, more significantly, her customer base, which she has built up over time due to her experience in this field. However, she finds that she is constantly out of stock because she is obliged to totally run it down before getting new stock owing to her small amount of capital. She would like to increase her stock of goods by buying wholesale and thus be able to satisfy the constant customer demand and avoid running out of stock. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Donyor

texts.ru: Донеру 54 года. Он добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Донер женатый мужчина и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Дети совершеннолетние. Донер живет в сельской местности и занимается услугой тракториста. Он имеет свой трактор и комбайн. Он имеет своих клиентов, то есть частные фермеры используют его услуги тракториста во время сбора урожая. Особенно он собирает фасоль, пшеницу и другие зерновые культуры. Он хочет улучшить условию проживания, то есть купить современные технологии для своих детей и внуков. Он должен отремонтировать свой трактор и комбайн, так как скоро начнется сезон его работы. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для ремонта трактора и комбайна. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему увеличить доход и таким образом поможет улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Donyor is 54 years old. He is a kind and hard-working person. He is married to a homemaker and has 4 grown children. He lives in a rural area where he works providing tractor services. He owns a tractor and a combine, and he has clients who pay for his services during harvest time. He mainly harvests beans, wheat, and other grains. He wants to improve his family's living standard, and in particular, to purchase modern technology for his children and grandchildren. He needs to fix his tractor and combine as his work season is going to begin very soon. Donyor is seeking a loan of 5,000 Tajikistan Somoni to carry out these repairs. He is waiting for your kindness. This loan will help him to increase his income, which will in turn allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To repair his farm vehicles

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб честный и справедливый молодой человек. Ему 27 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его жена работает учительницей в средней школе в их городе. Дети несовершеннолетние. Они учатся в средней школе. Они дружно живут в большом доме, где имеется фруктовый сад и большой коровник, где он держит коровы. Более 12 лет он занимается скотоводством. Он имеет 7 коровы, телята и одну лошадь. Он знает все тонкости своего дела и справляется с легкостью со своим бизнесом. Он покупает коровы, присматривает несколько месяцев и перепродает на местном рынке. Благодаря хорошему условию его коровы имеют большой спрос на местном рынке, и Сухроб имеет своих клиентов. Его жена помогает ему введения бизнеса. Он хочет развевать бизнес дальше и поэтому он должен увеличить количество скота. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 12000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Suhrob is an honest and fair-minded young man. He is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children who are in school. His wife is a teacher at the local high school. They live happily in a large house that has a fruit orchard and a big cattle shed where Suhrob keeps cows. For the last 12 years, he has been raising cattle. He now has 7 cows, calves, and 1 horse. He knows all the ins and outs of animal husbandry and is skilled at his business. He purchases livestock, takes care of them for several months, then sells them at the local market. Thanks to their good quality, there is a high demand for Suhrob's cows and he has built up his own clientele. His wife helps him to run the business. He now wants to develop his business further, and in order to do that, he needs to purchase more cattle. Suhrob is seeking a loan of 12,000 Tajikistan Somoni for that purpose. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to develop his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 34 years old from Naivasha and is married with three children who are all in school and between 13 and 5 years old.
Esther has a charcoal selling business that she has been doing for the past 3 years. She has applied for her second loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy more charcoal to add to her stock.
She hopes to see her business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to add to her stock.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture inside his store.
Zainab is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
For the past three years, Zainab's husband has been selling traditional jewelry such as necklaces and bracelets to customers and to other cosmetic stores. He has a good reputation among his customers, which makes his project a profitable one and a second source of income for the family.
Zainab is requesting a Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing additional collections of traditional jewelry that has been requested by his customers. This will increase sales and improve the family's living conditions.

 
About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase traditional jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Don Mercedes tiene 51 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en San Juan Pueblo Atlantida.
Don Mercedes hace 13 años establecio un negocio de un taller de ebanisteria donde elabora muebles de cocina, puertas, cantramarcos, mesas, sillas etc. El dedica tiempo completo, comenta que tiene bastante demanda en los muebles. Con los financiamientos que ha recibido a logrado mantener su negocio activo, y ha logrado sacar el capital economico para solventar los gastos de la familia. Solicito su septimo prestamo de 13,000 lempiras y lo necesita para comprar madera para elaborar puertas para la venta, y cumplir con los encargos que le hacen falta entregar.
Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y expandirse en los alrededores.
texts.en:
Mr. Mercedes is 51 years old, married and has three children. He lives in San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida. Thirteen years ago, Mr. Mercedes opened a workshop where he makes different woodworks: kitchen furniture, doors, counterframes, tables, chairs, etc. He works full time and says that his work is highly demanded. 

With the loans he has received, Mercedes has managed to keep his business going and to make enough to support his family. He requested his seventh loan of 13,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy wood to make doors and sell them, and to finish the orders he has not yet delivered. His goal is to expand his business and start selling in other regions.

loans.use: to buy wood to make doors and sell them.

loans.name: Parwin's Group

texts.en:
Parwin is a 24-year-old, young Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Parwin is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.
Parwin learned to sew at a young age, and has 10 years sewing experience. For her small, home-based business she already completed a small loan in the past which she used to purchase a generator, an overlock sewing machine, and a table for the machine. Having successfully repaid the previous loan and still looking for ways to improve her business, she is now taking a new loan. This time she would like to buy an embroidery machine and also focus on improving her work conditions by renewing her work area's floors and walls.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and also improve her work conditions by renewing her work area's floors and walls.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is the owner of a store where she sells all kinds of agricultural products. She has worked in this business for more than 9 years and so she already has a loyal customer base that always buys products from her.
Her husband is a businessman and in this way they help each other to get ahead. Hellen is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead.
She is requesting a loan to buy plants, vegetables, and more supplies to stock her business and to be able to offer good quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy plants and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Ishkhanuhi

texts.en:
Ishkhanuhi is from the Sardarapat village in the Armavir region or Armenia. She is a mother of two children and works at local supermarket as a clerk. She works hard to earn a high enough income to sustain her children’s life.
Ishkhanuhi's son Lyova is student at Armenian State Economic University. He studies hard, dreams to become a good specialist, find a job and ensure better life for his mother and sister.
As Ishkhanuhi is the only breadwinner of the family, it is very difficult for her to save money for Lyova's education. So she has applied for this loan to pay for her son's university tuition.
The loan is very important for Lyova to get higher education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three school going children. She runs a clothes shop which she has been operating for eight years. She also employs one person in the business. 
Sylvia was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 85,050 Kenya Shillings to purchase new clothes for sale e.g. handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts, etc.
Sylvia believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children. She is focused on owning a whole sale shop, despite the challenge of high costs of stock from the suppliers which make most of her items beyond the reach of the general public.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for sale e.g. handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts etc.

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is a 53-year-old woman from Iraq. She is married and is living with her husband. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Fatima is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.
Fatima has 8 years of experience with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business and she has already completed a loan in the past to purchase a new sewing machine and an over-lock sewing machine. She successfully repaid the loan and is now working on making further improvements to her business. She has now requested a new loan to be able to buy a generator, an embroidery machine and a water dispenser/cooler.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a generator, an embroidery machine and a water dispenser/cooler.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 53 years old, married to Stephen and has grown-up children. She takes care of one grandchild who is five years old.
She runs a bakery in Kiambaa village on the outskirts of Kangemi. 
She has been in this business for two years now and gets a monthly income of 40,000 shillings.
This will be Lucy's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy a mixing machine and two cows.

loans.use: to buy mixing machine for her bakery and two cows.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a businessman who lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and runs a vehicle garage where he provides mechanical repairs on the vehicles to his clients. He also sells water and owns a motorcycle which offers transport to the residents of the area for a fee. The business has been in operation for eight years. He was introduced to Milango by his relative and joined in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya Shillings to buy spare vehicle parts and a press machine. Patrick believes he can grow the business and employ more people. His main focus now is to meet the basic needs of the family, especially his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy spare vehicle parts and a press machine to use at his repair garage.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six children. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been running for four years. In this business, he sells retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. He heard about bee keeping and would like to invest in the business.
He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high cost of products.
Samuel is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy a motorcycle for transportation. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow to produce milk.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ESPERANZA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de papa, producción y venta de hortalizas, tienda de barrio, producción de papa y chuño, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de agricultura (producción de papa); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace años y en la actualidad trabaja con este negocio para generar recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su la ciudad de La paz y en las comunidades. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito ágil y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" ("New Hope") communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional office. The group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Delia is the president. The businesses which the group members run are varied and include the production and sale of potatoes, the production and sale of vegetables, a neighborhood store, production of potatoes and potato starch, and the sale of livestock.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Delia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago by the invitation of a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. She currently has an agricultural business (potato production). She says that she learned about this business from her parents years ago, and she currently works in the business to generate financial resources.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying seeds, which she will acquire from distributing companies and later sell in the city of La Paz and in towns. This type of work allows her to generate an income to maintain her household as much as possible, as she is married with four children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the flexible credit and the training.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Richar Alexander

texts.es:
Achuapa es un bello municipio ubicado en el departamento de León a 96 Km, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras, es aquí donde vive el joven Richar Alexander. 

 Richar Alexander se llama el Joven de 30 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, cuenta con un hijo bajo su cargo trabaja brindando sus servicios en una de las instituciones.

 Hoy en día se le ha presentado una oportunidad de poder mejorar su casa de habitación, esto sería de gran importancia para su familia vivir en mejores condiciones, por tal razón solicita un crédito a través de kiva y ceprodel, para la compra de: Cementó, Arena y Pago de Mono de Obra Para la mejora de su vivienda.

Agradece a este tipo de personas que ayudan con crédito y que siempre piensan en las personas pobres de darle la oportunidad de salir adelante luchando en su vida.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a beautiful town located in the department of León at 96 km. There are many enterprising people there and this is where the young man Richar Alexander lives.
Richar Alexander is the name of the young man of 30 years of age who fights for his life and for his family. He has one son in his care and he works in one of the institutions. 
Today, he has been presented an opportunity to be able to improve his house. This would be of great importance to his family who could live in better conditions. For this reason, he is requesting a loan through Kiva and Ceprodel to buy cement and sand, and to pay laborers to improve his home. 
He is grateful to the people who help with credit and who always think of the poor people and give them opportunities to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Germán Octavio

texts.es:
El joven Germán Octavio vive en Managua capital de Nicaragua, tiene un trabajador estable en una empresa del estado donde labora  como higienista desde hace tres años, su estado civil es casado con tres personas a su cargo.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para ajustar la  comprar de un terreno ya que Viven en casa de sus padres, para darle a su familia un techo digno.

Los sueños de Germán Octavio es tener su propia casita, porque solo  con el apoyo que Ceprodel y kiva le han brindado ha mejorado su nivel de vida, ya que con sus ingresos no podía, porque es muy poco que solo alcanza para la alimentación.
texts.en:
The young man Germán Octavio lives in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He has a stable job in a State business where he has worked as a hygienist for 3 years. He is married and has three people in his care.
He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL that he will use to  purchase some land and give his family a dignified home as he lives in his parents' house.
Germán Octavio's dream is to have his own little house. Only with the support that Ceprodel and Kiva have offered him has he been able to improve his standard of living as his wages are only enough to cover food.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Dory Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Dory a sus 42 años, vive con su madre y es la responsable de las obligaciones del hogar.  Tiene una cafetería en la cual trabaja toda la semana, donde vende especialmente comida, gaseosa y mecatos.  Gracias a esta tienda generan el sustento para la familia. La señora Dory desea comprar surtido como productos de la canasta familiar para  la preparación de comidas y bebidas, con esto podrá aumentar su nivel de ventas y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Sueña con ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en el mejor del sector.
texts.en:
Dory, 42, lives with her mother and is responsible for the household duties. She has a snack bar where she works all week, selling food, soft drinks, and snacks. Thanks to this store, she generates a livelihood for her family. 

Dory would like to buy inventory such as staple goods to prepare food and drinks, with which she will be able to increase her sales and thus improve her family's quality of life.

She dreams of expanding her business and making it into the best one in the area.

loans.use: to buy staple goods, drinks, and snacks.

loans.name: Emilba Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 45 años de edad, se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a la venta de fritos y comidas rápidas, en un carro que logró adquirir gracias al sacrificio y a su trabajo.  Con esta actividad ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y ofrecerle educación a sus tres hijos. Diariamente se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para preparar los insumos y posteriormente se dirige a comenzar su faena hasta las siete de la noche.
En la actualidad se encuentra necesitando insumos para seguir elaborando sus productos, y para ello solicita un crédito, que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta forma aumentar la calidad de vida para su núcleo familiar. Su mayor sueño es poder adecuar un local, para evitar las perdidas que le ocasionan la lluvia y mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old. She has been working for more than 5 years selling fries and fast food from a cart that she was able to purchase thanks to her hard work and sacrifices. With this work, she has been able to bring up her family and offer her 3 children an education. Every day, she gets up at 5 in the morning to prepare her supplies and then she carries out her labors until 7 at night.
Currently, she needs supplies to be able to make her goods and so she is requesting a loan that will enable her to increase her income and in this way to improve the quality of life for her immediate family. Her greatest dream is to have a room to work from to avoid the losses that she suffers when it rains and to improve her economic circumstances.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
Don José Ernesto vive en Managua  de Nicaragua, es una persona con buenos valores morales, se desempeña como supervisor de limpieza  en una empresa del estado  desde hace siete año, su estado civil es soltero con tres persona a su cargo.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para   comprar materiales tales como cinc, perlin y pago de mano  de obra, para la reparación del techo de su vivienda que esta en mal estado y darle seguridad a su familia.

José Ernesto esta muy agradecido con Ceprodel-Kiva porque a través de ellos solo así a salido adelante acondicionando y mejorando el nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José Ernesto lives in Managua in Nicaragua. He is a person with good moral values. He serves as a cleaning supervisor in a State business and has been doing this for 7 years. He is single and has 3 people in his care. 
The loan that he is requesting from Ceprodel will be used to buy materials such as zinc, beams, and paying laborers to repair the roof of his house which is in a bad state and so he can offer his family security.
José Ernesto is very grateful to Ceprodel-Kiva because only through them has he been able to renovate and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno ya es independiente y el pequeño tiene retardo mental y es por eso que necesita mucho cuidado y un trato especial por lo cual le impide trabajar todo el día a Elizabeth, viven en casa de sus familiares, ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la misma está ubicada en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente Elizabeth trabaja como ayudante de cocina durante toda la mañana y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para el pago de alimentación y servicios básicos, es por eso que el crédito lo requiere para comprar insumos como arroz, fideo, carne y otros, para  preparar y vender comida de forma independiente en la puerta de su casa y poder cuidar de su hijito.
El sueño de Elizabeth es mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar a una institución especialista para el cuidado de su hijito y con eso también disponer de más tiempo para mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito  junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and has 2 children, of whom one is independent and the little one has a mental disability and so needs a lot of care and a special treatment which prevents Elizabeth from being able to work all day. They live with relatives and occupy just one room with adobe walls and an earth floor. The house is located in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. 
Elizabeth currently works in food preparation during the mornings and, with the little that she earns, she can't afford to pay for food and basic services. This is why she needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, noodles, meat, and others to prepare and sell food independently from the door of her home and to be able to care for her little boy.
Elizabeth's dream is to improve her income so that she can pay a specialist institution to care for her little boy, which would also allow her more time to improve her income. 
This is the second time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: compra de insumos para preparar comidas e iniciar un negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.name: Awankoh

texts.en:
Awonkoh is married with seven children and they all live in a seven bedroom house in Bafut Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life, among which are sickness in his family and the death of family members and friends, which led to the extravagant expenditure of money on death preparation and on medication for the sick, forced acquisition by his neighbors has also been a problem.

With this new loan, he will invest in poultry farming by buying feed for his pigs, piglets, chicks, as well as materials for his tailoring business. He is very positive his business will succeed because he has sought expert knowledge from his friends and family members. They encouraged him, saying that because he has all the knowledge required to carry out the business successfully, there is a ready market in that locality who will buy from him. He also has a good business site for his tailoring workshop. There are students around who will constantly buy their dresses and uniforms from him. With this business activity, the community will have good designer dresses because he will use his professional knowledge in the field.

With the profit from the loan, he will expand his business, help the needy in the community, and pay for his children's medication, feeding and education expenses. He prefers GHAPE loans because of its low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy material for sewing, pig and feed for pigs and chicks

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 27-year-old man. He’s married to Hanin, a wonderful lady. Since their marriage, Mohammad has had to work under pressure, trying his best to bring added income to the family and enrich their life. He owns a shop where he sells gas tanks. His shop is located in a very strategic place which allows him to attract lots of clients. As he wants to enlarge his business, he decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of gas tanks to carry on his work in a proper way. He wishes to amplify his income and secure the needed savings for his future life plans.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of gas tanks.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a married Lebanese man. He’s 62 years old. He lives with his wife in their house that is located in one of the most beautiful villages in Lebanon. He manages the family’s household. He is working nonstop to give him and his wife a proper life and has been working in his own bakery for more than thirty years. He’s well known for his delicious food. His most popular Lebanese traditional food is the “Manakish”, and it’s baked and sold steaming hot to early commuters. They are loyal to him and always asking for his delightful goods. Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new oven to continue production and expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. In the near future, he has more than a few ideas to help grow his business, and he hopes to take more Kiva loans to achieve his goals, especially with the great result he has obtained from his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy a new oven for his bakery.

loans.name: Rema Group

texts.fr:
Séraphine fait partie du groupe  Rema et   habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Déo, un agent de l’Office Burundais des Recettes. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de  6 à 10 ans, tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 élèves membres de sa famille élargie.

Elle fait le commerce des habits   depuis 12 ans. 

Elle  est à son  treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d' habits à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années,  elle voudrait devenir une commerçante grossiste des habits et voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Séraphine is a member of the Rema group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 32 years old and married to Déo, an officer from the Burundi Tax Office. They have 4 children together, aged between 6 and 10, and all of whom study. 
She also has in her care 2 schoolchildren who are members of her extended family. 

She has sold clothing for a living for 12 years. She is on her third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she is seeking, she aims to boost her capital to purchase a lot of clothes for re-sale, in order to generate higher revenues. 

In the coming years, she would like to become a wholesale trader of clothing and would like to see her children studying and completing their studies.

loans.use: to boost her business capital and purchase a lot of clothes for re-sale, in order to generate higher revenues

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama lives with her partner John, in the town of Kisauni. They both work in retail trade. Salama has a well-stocked store, and she also has a retail shop. In her store she sells vegetables, fruit, consumer staples, drinks and dairy products. She is a self-sacrificing person who works hard each day to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

Salama will use this loan to buy vegetables, fruit etc. She thanks Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the assistance that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Bismar Gregorio

texts.es:
Bismar es habitante y originario de bella Ciudad Darío situada en el Norte de Nicaragua, su estado civil es acompañado y su núcleo familiar está compuesto por cinco persona, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. Este señor se caracteriza por ser una persona humilde responsable y trabajadora.

Actualmente es trabajador de una empresa de acueducto desempeñándose como fontanero con una antigüedad laboral de 15 años es importante señalar que sus ingresos lo destina para la alimentación y educación de su familia.

Bismar está mejorando su vivienda y con el financiamiento que solicita lo va destinar para pago de mano de obra, a la misma vez agradece a kiva por el apoyo brindado, ya que es la única manera que puede realizar la mejora en su vivienda  y dar mejor condición y comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Bismar is a resident and native of beautiful Ciudad Dario located in northern Nicaragua.  He is married and his household consists of five people.  He has three school-age children.  He is humble, responsible and hard-working.

Bismar is currently employed by an aqueduct company as a plumber with 15 years seniority.  His income goes toward food and education for his family.

Bismar is making improvements to his home.  With the financing he is requesting, he is going to pay for labor.  He is thankful to Kiva for their support as this is the only way he can make improvements to his home for his family's comfort.

loans.use: to pay for labor to tile his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizer for coffee production.

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
He is married with eight children and they live in a five bedroom house in Bafut Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life among which are sickness in his family, the death of his father and father-in-law, and some of his bottles are stolen by customers who buy drinks and don’t return the bottles.

With the new loan requested, he will buy more crates for his off-license business, bottles, musical sets and a generator since there are constant light failures in his area of residence. He holds a positive view that his business will succeed because he is at the center of his locality with a good business site. It is well decorated; thus, inducing customers to drink in his bar. People in the locality will buy drinks from him for ceremonies like weddings, death celebrations and birth celebrations. With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of drinks for ceremonies. Drinks will be sold to customers at discount prices and there will be availability at all times.

With the profit from this loan, he will expand the business by buying more crates, finance his children’s education, and renew the business site. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayments.

loans.use: to buy more crates, bottles, chairs, a generator and musical set

loans.name: Elkin Daniel

texts.es: Élkin a sus 32 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 20 años, actividad que aprendió por tradición familiar y hoy se ha convertido en la fuente de ingresos para él y su familia. Gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo a logrado sembrar un cultivo de café y plátano, los cuales comercializa en la plaza de su municipio. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas y abonos para sacar una producción de excelente calidad y mejorar su situación económica. Espera que con esta inversión pueda generar los ingresos necesarios para garantizarle a su hijo de un año de edad una buena educación.
texts.en:
Élkin is 32 years old.  He has worked as a farmer for more than 20 years.  He learned to farm as a family tradition and today it has become the source of income for him and his family.  Thanks to his commitment and effort, he has succeeded in sowing a crop of coffee and bananas, which he sells in the town square.  

Currently he is requesting this loan to purchase farming supplies and fertilizer in order to have a harvest of excellent quality crops, which will improve his financial situation.  He hopes that this investment can generate the necessary income to guarantee that his one year old son receives a good education.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 37 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his wife and parents. David requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was always rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly pension of David’s parents. It brings in a total of 250 laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

David requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit David will open a café in the center of Telavi. He has rented a commercial space and will purchase inventory for the café. After the café is opened, the family will have a source of income. David will reinvest part of the profit in the business and with the other part provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to open a cafe.

loans.name: Nemiah

texts.en:
For many years, Nemiah has been an enthusiast of Zumba, a type of dance workout routine. After carefully studying her options, Nemiah decided to lease a dance studio and hire Zumba instructors and start her business.

Nemiah will use her finance skills to manage the business. She will keep her full-time job as a finance assistant to secure income for herself and her family. The loan will be used to complete the renovations of the dance studio and purchase dance equipment. 
She hopes to introduce Zumba to the community – especially to mothers and elderly people who would like to work out and be fit while having fun.

loans.use: to renovate and equip her Zumba dance studio in Prince George’s County, Maryland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a professional camera.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru has two children all of whom attend school. She has a grocery store that with much sacrifice has been able to stay open. She rises at dawn to go to the Kongowea market to make her purchases and once a week she goes to the wholesale foodstuffs market, thus managing to lower costs and retain a good clientele. She comments that she does well since her store is well-stocked, and she offers her customers a very good variety. Her goal is to continue growing this way to continue helping her family.

Nuru needs this loan to buy beverages, baked goods, meats and other items in quantity to earn better profits. In the future, she wants to enlarge the business and also establish another business to earn more profits to be able to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, meats and other items in quantity to earn better profits.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 23-year-old Lebanese single woman who lives with her parents and three siblings, who are all working. Her father is the one responsible for supporting the family money-wise. But since his income is not enough, she decided to start working as a hairdresser receiving customers at her house. Her story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges Lebanese women are facing running a business and at the same time supporting their families. 

Aya is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses. With her requested youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies so as to better serve her clients. Aya hopes her business will grow and wants to be able to give her family needed support.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is from Kisauni, Mombasa. Her husband is a driver and together they have seven children. She works selling fruits and vegetables in a little shed at the entrance to town.

With sacrifice and dedication she managed to get her seven children ahead, with the help of her husband. She is a very hardworking woman. She says she always has worked and she is not afraid of challenges. Her goal is to be able to continue growing and have a bigger shed to continue helping her family and her husband.

Kadzo is coming to Yehu Microfinance and to Kiva for a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit to be able to supply her business with top-quality products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is pro-active young women from Lori village. She is married and is getting her Masters degree at the Public Administration Academy of the Republic of Armenia. Together with her studies, Narine also works at a local bookstore. Narine and her husband work hard to cover their daily costs and sustain their living. Unfortunately, it is very hard for Narine to save money for her education so she has applied for this loan to pay for university tuition.

The loan is very important for Narine to complete her education, find a better job and ensure a better life for  her young family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Gilma Rosa

texts.es:
Gilma de 50 años de edad, es una mujer que se ha ganado  la admiración de su familia por su empeño y ganas de buscar un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Después de padecer el abandono de su esposo, Gilma se vio en la necesidad de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. En vista de que las oportunidades de empleo fueron nulas debido a su bajo nivel académico, decidió subemplearse y comenzó vendiendo frutas de manera ambulante en el centro de la Ciudad de Medellín, Antioquia. Posteriormente cambió de actividad ya que la rentabilidad era muy baja y las pérdidas muy altas. Se dedicó a la venta de ropa y accesorios. Gracias a la actividad su familia hoy goza de mejores condiciones de vida. 
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y poder garantizarle a su hijo menor acceso a la educación superior.
texts.en:
Gilma, 50 years of age, is a woman who has earned the admiration of her family for her commitment and desire to seek a better future for her children.  After suffering the abandonment of her husband, Gilma recognized the need to generate income to sustain her household.  Seeing that employment opportunities were nil due to her low level of education, she decided to employ herself as a street vendor selling fruit in the center of the city of Medellín, Antioquia.  Due to low profitablity and high losses, she later switched to selling clothing and accessories. Thanks to her business activities, her family today enjoys better living conditions.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of goods in order to increase sales and to guarantee her younger son access to higher education.

loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
He is married with eight children and they all live in a five-bedroom house in Bafut Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced many challenges in life, among which are sickness in his family, the death of his father, and theft. He was poisoned by his brother and it led to an operation.

With the new loan requested, he will buy piglets, chicks, and food for the chicks and piglets. He holds a positive view of his business succeeding. He will buy good species and also a good mixture of feed for their upbringing. He has people who will buy the animals for resale and also there are many farmers in the locality who will buy the droppings from the piglets and chicks. From this activity the community will buy piglets for resale and the droppings from the animals will serve as manure for farms which will increase fertility of the soil and also output.

The profit from the loan will be used for expansion of the business and repayment of empowerment credit. He prefers GHAPE loans because of moderate interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy chicks and piglets

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
This loan will help Alexandre expand his house painting company.

After moving to the United States from Brazil over ten years ago, Alexandre began working for various house painting companies. In 2011, with hopes of making a better life for his wife and three children, Alexandre began his own painting business. 

Alexandre is now looking for a loan to purchase painting guns, compressors, and ladders in order to expand his business. He hopes to one day be able to hire employees to help generate jobs in his local community in Weymouth, MA.

loans.use: To purchase additional painting equipment

loans.name: Beinwuna

texts.en:
She was born in 1978. She lives in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon, in a four bedroom apartment with her husband and two children.  She has faced many challenges in life including sickness in her family and inadequate capital to start up a business of her own. She dropped out of school at an early age which has contributed to her severe poverty.

She will use this loan to buy a sewing machine and thread and to rent a shop. She will also invest part of it in her farm, buying seedlings and paying for labour. She believes that this business will succeed, because she has diversified her business venture into farming and tailoring. Her community will benefit from low prices and ready-made clothes.

She will take care of her feeding her family, medication and the education of her children with the profit from the loan. She hopes to expand her business in future and also help vulnerable children in her community. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, installment repayment intervals and, most of all, the training offered at GHAPE meetings.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and farming inputs

loans.name: Alva Luz

texts.es:
La Señora Alba vive en Quevedo (Ecuador), ella tiene 61 años de edad. Los hermanos de ella han crecido económicamente a base de su negocio, eso le incentivo a ella para poder su negocio y también porque le gusto la venta de calzado en general. 

Ella trabaja en la venta de calzado de lunes a viernes desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta la noche. Ella no tiene ninguna dificultad en su trabajo. Ella es viuda, tiene 4 hijos ya son profesionales todos.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar calzado en general, y una vitrina. Ella desea para el futuro tener todas las cosas que le faltan en su hogar, tener salud para poder trabajar y no depender de nadie, hasta que Dios le permita.
texts.en:
Alba, age 61, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  Her siblings have grown financially from the business.  This motivated her to be able to set up her business.  Also, she did this because she liked selling shoes.

She works selling shoes on Mondays through Fridays from 8:00 in the morning until night time.  She does not have any difficulty in her work.  

She is a widow, and she has four children.  They are all professionals now.

She will use the loan to buy general footwear and a display case.

In the future she wishes to have all of the things she needs for her household.  She also wishes to have good health in order to be able to work and not be dependent on anyone for as longs as God allows her.

loans.use: to buy general footwear.

loans.name: Harold

texts.es:
Harold habita en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñon, un bello y encantador municipio, donde existen diferentes actividades comerciales y ganadería. 

Harold se llama el Joven de 33 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de dos hijitos bajo su cargo que tanto ama y estima, se dedica a brindar sus servicios laborales en uno de los centro de enseñanza. 

De igual forma su esposa se dedica a brindar sus servicios laborales, hoy en día se vio la necesidad de querer ampliar un poco más su vivienda, debido a que en su familia va creciendo, solicita un crédito para la compra de: zin, Ladrillo, Cemento y pago de Mano de Obra. Esto solo lo puede lograr con un crédito a través de Ceprodel y Kiva le financie este tipo de actividad. 

Agradece a este tipo de personas que ayudan con crédito y que siempre piensan en las personas de escasos recursos económico  de darle la oportunidad de poder salir adelante en su vida.
texts.en:
Harold lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñon, a beautiful and charming town where many different business and farming activities take place.

Harold is 33 years old.  He fights for his life and those of the two small children under his care, who he loves and appreciates.  He works providing labor services at a school.  Likewise, his wife works providing labor services.  

Today they see the necessity of wanting to expand their home a little more since their family is growing.  He is requesting this loan to purchase zinc, bricks, and cement and to pay laborers.  He is only able to achieve this with a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva finances this type of activity.

He is grateful to all the people who help with this loan and always think about people with limited financial resources to give them the opportunity to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, bricks, and cement, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Hijas Del Illampu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HIJAS DE ILLAMPU”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Soledad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, pensión, tienda, chofer, minería, venta de frutas, venta de comida, costura de cubrecamas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Soledad es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de salchipapas (comida); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años ya que cambio de rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el mejoramiento de sus herramientas (compra papa por quintal) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor de su comunidad y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Daughters of Illampu Association will begin their fourth loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer ("Pro Women"), as part of the Achacachi Focal Center.  The group includes ten members and is directed by a board in which Soledad serves as president.  The members' businesses are varied and include: owning a bookstore, running a shop, chauffeuring, mining, selling fruit, selling food and sewing quilts.

Loans that are taken out by the Association benefit the microentrepreneurs, of whom Soledad is a constituent.  It has been two years since she formed the Pro Mujer group at the invitation of a promoter of the institution who came to visit her at her home.  Soledad owns a business selling salchipapas, a local snack of potatoes and fried sausages.  The business was launched several years ago when she changed jobs.

The loan that the group is requesting now will be used in part to buy potatoes by the quintal (100 kg) at wholesale prices from local vendors.  The product will then be made and sold in its retail space. This workflow will allow Soledad to generate maximum income to provide as much support as possible to her household, since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she repsonds that  she likes receiving the loans and health training.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in 100 kilogram units (quintales).

loans.name: Gladis Helena

texts.es:
Gladis de 42 años de edad. Se dedica a la fabricación de arepas con el propósito de colaborarle a su conyuge con los gastos del hogar y la educación de su hija de nueve años de edad. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano e inicia su faena en la elaboración de arepas, las cuales distribuye entre sus vecinas, en la actualidad elabora alrededor de 18 paquetes diarios.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de un molino eléctrico y la construcción de un horno de carbón  con el fin de aumentar su capacidad de producción y mejorar sus ingresos. Espera poder convertir su negocio en una microempresa y brindarles a otras personas la oportunidad de laborar.
texts.en:
Gladis is 42 years old.  She works making arepas in order to help her husband with the household expenses and her 9 year old daughter's education.  She gets up early every day to start her job of making arepas, which she distributes to her neighbors.  She currently makes about 18 packages every day.

Currently she is requesting this loan to purchase an electric mill and build a coal oven with the goal of increasing her production capacity and increasing her income.  She hopes that she can convert her one person business into a small business that can provide others the opportunity to work.

loans.use: to purchase an electric mill and construct a coal oven.

loans.name: Katherine Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Clienta Katherine vive en Quevedo, ella tiene 30 años de edad. A ella le gusta el comercio de ropa y zapatos desde mucho antes de casarse,  y ahora le ayuda de sustento para seguir con sus estudios. 

Ella realiza la venta sola, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta la noche. Ella no tiene ningún inconveniente al realizar su trabajo. Ella está casada su esposo es sargento en la Policía Nacional, tiene 2 hijas y estudian en escuelas particular.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar zapatos, pantalones, blusas, etc. Ella desea terminar su carrera de abogada y que sus hijas también obtengan una buena educación y salud para que cumplan sus sueños.
texts.en:
Katherine, age 30, lives in Quevedo.  She has liked selling clothes and shoes for many years even before she got married.  It now helps her to support the continuation of her studies.

She sells alone from nine in the morning until the nighttime.  She has no difficulty doing her work.

She is married, and her husband is a Sergeant in the National Police.  She has two daughters, and they go to private schools.

She will use the loan to buy shoes, pants, and blouses, etc.  

She wishes to finish her education to be a lawyer.  She wishes that her daughters also get a good education, have good health, and fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear.

loans.name: José Haroldo

texts.es:
El sauce un bello Municipio ubicado en el departamento de León, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras, con espíritu de superación, es aquí donde habita José Haroldo. 

José Haroldo se llama el señor de 61 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, brinda su servicio en uno de los centro de enseñanza. 

Vive con su esposa y dos hijos bajo su cargo, ella trabaja como ama de casa, pero hoy en día tiene un problema de salud donde necesita de mucho medicamento para mejorar, su esposa que tanto la ama y la estima viendo que con lo poco que el gana no puede cubrir este tipo de gasto, tomo la decisión de buscar a Ceprodel y Kiva para que estos le financien un crédito para la compra de medicamento para mejorar la salud de su esposa y así seguir luchando con su vida y la de su familia. 

Agradece a este tipo de personas que ayudan con crédito y que siempre piensan en las personas pobres y de bajos ingresos de darle la oportunidad de poder salir adelante en su vida.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful town located in the department of Leon where many enterprising people with a spirit of improvement live, including José Haroldo.

José Haroldo is 61 years old and fights for his life and that of his family.  He provides services at one of the schools.  He lives with his wife and two children who are in their care.  His wife is a housewife, but currently she has a health problem that needs a lot of medicines to improve.  He loves and appreciates his wife, and seeing that his small income could not cover that kind of expense, he decided to go to Ceprodel and Kiva for a loan.  He will use the loan to purchase medicine to improve his wife's health so that he can continue fighting for his life and that of his family.

He is grateful to the kind of people who help with the loan and always think about giving opportunities to people with limited incomes to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for his wife.

loans.name: Shu

texts.en:
She is married with two children and they all live in a two-bedroom house in Bamenda, Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, among which are persistent sickness and the death of her mother, leaving her alone at a very tender age to take care of her younger silblings, and climate change that affected her farm.

The new loan requested will be used to buy piglets and feed for her piglets, and vegetable seedlings for her farm. She is positive the business will succeed because she has experience, and she will buy a good breed of piglets and also buy a well-mixed feed for their feeding. With this activity the community will benefit from the droppings from the piglets as manure for the fertilization of their farms thus leading to improved yields and more vegetables.

The profit from the loan will be used for feeding her family, the education of her children, expansion of the business by buying more piglets, and also expanding her farmland. GHAPE loans are preferable to her because of low interest rates, and a well-structured repayment interval.

loans.use: to buy piglets and seedlings

loans.name: Elia Humbertina

texts.es:
Elia es una mujer con 54 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y agradecida con DIOS, con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante casada y madre de 5 hijos los cuales son adultos y de ella solo depende una nieta la cual estudia en el kinder y los papás viven en E.E.U.U. Ella tiene un grado de educación no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos y no pudieron apoyarla. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado al cultivo de café actividad practicada por su familia hasta hoy en día siendo este el único sustento ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra hace más de 20 años y en la actualidad sigue practicando con su esposo. La tierra que juntos en familia trabajan fue comprada por ellos después de muchos años de sacrificio pudieron ahorrar y comprar la tierra que hoy cultivan la cual está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.  

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Su sueño es poder emprender un negocio el cual sirva para dar un valor agregado a sus cultivos de café como un empaque y poder venderlo en el mercado para de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos para seguir ampliando sus siembras y que sea herencia para que sus hijos puedan seguir trabajando y pasar de generación a generación.
texts.en:
Elia is 54 years old.  She is a fighter who is enterprising and grateful to God and who has a desire to improve and succeed.  She is married and has five children who are all adults.  She has a granddaughter in kindergarten who depends on her since her parents live in the United States.  She went to school through fourth grade and could not continue due to a lack of financial support since her parents had limited resources and could not support her.  

Since her childhood, she has worked cultivating coffee.  Her family did this work and today it supports her family.  Her parents taught her to work the land more than twenty years ago and now she works with her husband.  Their land was purchased after many years of sacrifice to save and purchase the land they cultivate today.  It is located two kilometers away from her house and she walks there every day.

Currently she is requesting help to purchase fertilizer and manure to maintain her coffee crops so that she has a healthy and profitable harvest that generates income and profits so that she can continue investing.

Her dream is to start a business that will give value to her coffee crops such as packaging them and selling them in the market.  This would allow her to improve her income so that she could continue expanding her crops, and it would be an inheritance for her children to continue working and pass from generation to generation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and manure to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reopen his taco and lunch business.

loans.name: Hector Dario

texts.es:
Héctor de 50  años,  es un emprendedor quien tiene su propio negocio en el cual vende dulces y minutos de celular, su horario de trabajo es de 7:30 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. de lunes a sábado. Trabaja arduamente para generar sus propios ingresos y ofrecerle a su hijo una buena educación. 
Comenzó a desarrollar su actividad debido a que se le acabó su contrato como albañil, situación que lo condujo a subemplearse para la generación de recursos y el sostenimiento de su familia.
Hoy requiere de la compra de surtido,  para aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos con el fin de garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Su mayor sueño es poder tener vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Héctor is 50 years old. He is an entrepreneur who has his own business where he sells candies and cell phone minutes. His work schedule is from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Monday through Saturday. He works hard to generate his own income and offer his son a good education.

He started developing his activity because his work contract as a bricklayer ran out. This situation led to him finding secondary employment to generate resources and support his family.

Today he needs to stock up to increase his sales and improve his income to guarantee his family a better quality of life. His biggest dream is own his own home.

loans.use: to purchase supplies

loans.name: Emmanuela

texts.en:
A widowed mother of four children living in a seven-bedroom apartment in Bafut Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon, Emmanuela has faced many challenges in life. Amongst them are her children’s ill-health, the death of her elder sister in a weather-related accident, and inadequate finances for educating, feeding and meeting the medical needs of her children.

With this new loan request, Emmanuela will operate a provision store in her compound, open a garden to cultivate vegetables, and also sell secondhand dresses in her neighbourhood. With the resulting profits, she will educate her children and provide three square meals to her family since she is the only bread winner since her husband’s death.

Emmanuela prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy secondhand dresses and store provisions to sell,  and seedlings.

loans.name: Nchang Grace

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with five children, four of them below the age of fifteen. They all live in a two-room apartment house in Bafut Mezam North west region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, among which sickness in her family, poverty, the death of her husband, brothers and a sister who were very supportive to her in her day-to-day life and hatred from her fellow women in the family.

With the new loan requested, she will buy cocoyam, maize and beans seedlings. She will also buy vegetable seeds. All these will help in her farm work. Part of the loan will also be used to pay labour for clearing and tilling which will ease her farm work. According to her this business is bound to succeed because she plans on putting in the best effort required for the business to grow from strength to strength, and she will buy just the pressing items needed by the community.

From this business the community will benefit from availability of food items at all times, she will sell at reduced prices, commodities will be sold at their door step so they won’t go to long distances in search of the items.

With the profit from this business, she will educate her children and insure being able to pay for their education, and provide three square meals to her family since she is the only breadwinner after her husband’s death. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to pay for farm labour and buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Wasang

texts.en:
Wasang is married with three children and they all live in a seven bed apartment house in Bafut Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, including sickness in her family, poverty, and the death of her husband, brothers and a sister who were very supportive to her in her day to day life, as well as hatred from her fellow women in the family.

With this new loan, she will buy hair treatment product, body lotion, body treatment and other products for her cosmetic shop. According to her, this business is bound to succeed because she plans to put in the best effort required for the business to grow from strength to strength and she will buy just the pressing needs needed by the community. From this business, the community will benefit from the availability of the items at all times. She will sell them at reduced prices at her neighbors' doorsteps so they won’t go to long distances in search of the items.

With the profit from this business, she will educate her children and insure that she can pay for their education. She will also provide three square meals to her family since she is the only breadwinner after her husband’s death. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy inner wears, hair treatment and body lotions

loans.name: Jose Cruz
